Southern Sunrise: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake well and pour into Cocktail glasses.
Napalm-Death: Take a shot glass and take equal amounts of the liquor. First the Kahlua, then slowly pour down the Drambuie, then the Bailey's and last the Cointreau. Try to get fine layers.
Red Royal Shot: It tastes like a cherry coke with a kick. It should warm you straight down the middle. If not, drink another. The best we can figure this drink came from a tavern in Carlinville, Illinois called the "Lost Dutchman." (A civilized tavern)
Pucker Sucker: Combine ingredients and serve as a shot.
AT&T;: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir
Citronade: Mix Lemonade and Citron into a Collins glass....shake or stir, add ice, and drink.
Peppermint Stick: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
Alex Chi-Chi: A beautiful cocktail to drink during the summer vacancions.
Gangreen: Created in an outside bar in Thailand following the Gulf War
Godiva Peppermint Patty: Excelent hand warmer for cold nights plus some alcohol to warm the spirit. If Hot Chocoalte is made with milk, the milk will have a tendency to react with the Schnapps. Whole milk reacts more but gives a creamier taste. The whip cream will give a better (creamier) texture and taste to water based hot chocolate.
Zombie #4: Strain ingredients into collins glass filled with ice. Top with 151-proof Rum.
An Arif: Combine everything together in order it is listed, you may add Kool-Aid mix if desired, but make sure to add the lemon juice last. It is called an Arif because it will tend to block your nuts from getting off if you have too many of these.
Pistachio Cream: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.
This-n-That: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.
Blue Meanie: It tastes sweet, kinda like Kool-Aid. I was at a party one night, and was messing around, figuring out what I could put together that would taste good. I tried this, and boy, did it taste good.
Orange Cocktail: Stir lemon juice and orange juice in a mixing glass, strain into a large cocktail glass.
Seaside-Summerbliss: Excelent when it's warm out side in the sun, and you just want to relax!
Widow Woods' Nightcap: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Bloody Tampon: This drink is sure to give the weak PMS (Pump My Stomach) symptoms.
Bakkus: Pour the ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake well, pour into a tall cocktail glass and add a slice of lemon.
Malibu Express: Mix all ingredients together. Serve on ice.
Golden Daze: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Skylab Fallout: Drink is strong - if your out at a club - limit yourself to two drinks - There is always another day.
Ganggreen: This drink should be enjoyed after a hearty steak and potatoe meal,just before you start playing cards and smoking stogies with your friends. So eat, drink, and be merry.
Parappa the Drunk Rappa: Pour shots over ice, add coke and strain into glass
Green K: Drink created by Kerstin Nedele in September 1997
Green Thing: Shake well till it is a cream color and is frothing.
Black Tartan: Straight: Float all ingredients. -- On the Rocks: Shake with ice and strain over ice
Brown Eye Opener: Mix all five together then chill.
Spring Feeling Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sloppy Joe: Pour cranberry and orange juice in cup, then add the sprite. Last, add the rum.
Jimmy's special: -A good drink that reminds you about sleeping beuty.
Three Stages of Friendship: Mix all three in a shot glass and shoot the damn thing.
Status Quo: Mix everything together and add some crunched ice and olives!
Delta Sunset: This is called a Delta Sunset at Bubba Gump's
Green Summer: A bunch of friends and I figured this drink out at a party in the fall of '97, and we pretty much all like it.
Patmcpacke: Throw em all together and stir
Outrigger: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Vodka Passion: It took me many years to locate a good source for passion fruit syrup. If you have a real interest in tasting this drink, and need the passion syrup, e-mail me.
220 BTU: Created one night because several guys were commenting about a new shot that should be called a two-twenty and it needed to be blue. Add up the proof of alcohols to equal 220.
Oatmeal Cookie: With ice, shake/stir and serve in shot glasses. The original drink called for the Goldslager but I actually like it with HotDam better..
Arizona Antifreeze: Just the shot to warm up your insides !!!!
The Roni: after a couple of these, you'll know what's it's like... havin' a RONI!!!!!
Chocolate Almond: Can also be made with light creme de cacao, but is much better with dark.
Oatmeal Cookie with Raisins: Blend, add ice, strain into rocks glass
Undertow: Excellent balance of sour and sweet.
Beautiful: Pour each ingredient into the snifter and serve.
Spiced Cherry: Put the Spiced Rum in the glass. Fill with cherry coke. Stir.
Snake Piss: Fill glass with ice (crushed or cubes). Add ingredients and stir ocassionally.
Moninger's Madness: This drink came from a night where we wanted to see what went down the smoothest but got us drunk the quickest. We all decided this one was the best. Have fun with this one and let me know how you like it.
Indian Summer: Mix all together and take all at once as a shot.
Salt and Pepper Martini: Combine vermouth and Absolut in mixing glass over ice and stir. Strain into a cocktail glass with a salted rim.
Kir Royale: Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top
Southern Raspberry Tart: Taste differs with amount of sour mix. It tastes better with a little less than an ounce.
Midnight Mint: Midnight Mint as created by Jamie Terrell of London's Atlantic Bar & Grill.
Wu Wu: If a big bloke asks you for one, don't shout it out all over the bar like I did in the Blarney Stone Too in San Diego.
Ultimate Blue Frozen Margarita: For those who don't like salted glasses, substitute red party sugar, for a sweeter, prettier drink, excellent for the novice margarita drinker.
Blue Caboose: I was being not very nice and trying to make a shot that would make a friend of mine sick. She drank the shot and said that it was good she then decided that she would get to name and it was dubbed the "Blue Caboose".
Freddy Fudpucker: Pour the tequila and orange juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Pouring slowly and carefully over the back of a teaspoon, float the Galliano on top of the drink.
Vermont Maple Blaster: Great drink for after skiing or anything else. Famous traditional drink at the "Backhome Cafe" in Rutland, Vermont. The Backhome Cafe is also 20 minutes (on a bad day) from Killington, Vermont.
Donna Reed: Called a Donna Reed for two reasons: (1) it's pink (2) it was originally created in a 1950's-vintage blender. Fairly mild taste, not much alcohol.
Cossak: Originated at a Rocky Horror convention!
Classic Pimms: Stir, and add a slice of lemon and a few mint leaves.
Buttery Nipple #1: The Butterscotch Schnapps makes up the bottom layer. The top layer of Baileys should be added using a spoon. This is a layered shot. Delicious!!
Mallelieu: Pour the rum, Grand Marnier, and orange juice into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Saurian Brandy: The recipe comes from the 'Official Star Trek Cooking Manual' (Bantam Books 1978) by Mary Ann Piccard, but not even Paramount will acknowledge it anymore.
Miami Beach Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Breast Milk: Mix all ingredients in tin with crushed ice. Shake, strain, and serve.
Fuck Me Up: This drink is also known as a beam me up scotty, only layer ingredients in shooter glass and drink!
Creamy Tan: Add ice and all the ingredients into a shaker and shake well. Then serve in a large glass.
Loud-Mouth: This is a Winter drink which can only be consumed outdoors preferbly in an alpine environment. It is should be consumed in small swigs from a French Canteen type of devide and only after a epic day of skiing...Why yes it's strong but you'll be the better for it.
Strawberry Punch #2: Put the sherbet in a bowl and pour the 7-up over the sherbet. Stir until the sherbet is melted. This makes a pretty pink punch. You can use diet soda for a punch that is less sweet.
Jogeir: Mix lime vodka, absolut citron and juice together and put it in a shot glas, then add galliano right before serving. Shoot it.
Hurricane Laura: A College Adventure that ended in the creation of a drink being drank at UMBC.
911: Mix equal proprtions of each in one shot glass.
Tropical Teaser: Place in a cold shaker with ice. Shake for one minute and serve over ice.
Hudson Bay: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Red, White and Blue: Will create a red, white and blue layered drink.
Rock And Rye Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Boomerang Shot: This one's for Kevin Pshar!!! Thanx Corpral!
Smooth Sailin': Mix all ingredients in a medium-sized bowl. Freeze in small airtight containers. To serve, remove from freezer and let thaw about 10 minutes. Scrape or scoop into stemmed glasses. Serve with straws, if desired. Makes 14 six-ounce drinks.
The Incredible Hulk: Add 2 oz of Captain Morgan to glass. Add sugar. Add Mountain Dew till mix turns green.
Brush Fire: WARNING: Extremely hot! This drink must be shot like it is a shot.
The Hurtado: Dont be fooled by the taste. This one will knock you on the ass! Before you drink yell "El Tanque"!
Firetruck: Serve in a Shotglass, and toss it straight down.
Pooky and Chooky: Shake with ice. Pour into glass without ice.
Slimer: Add liquer first. Use a glass beverage container to highlight the the green color.
Banshee Berry: pour each of the three ingredients into a shot glass. Stir.
Golden Comfort: Mix, then pour into shot glass
Retribution: Burns like fire and tastes like Christmas.
Catalina Margarita: Shake with cracked ice and strain into chilled cocktail or margarita glass.
Siberian Slider: mix equal parts into a tumber filled with cracked ice. Stir liberally and sip slowly.
Pussy Foot: Shake or blend briefly, strain into a highball glass. Garnish with fresh fruit, cherry, and a drinking straw.
Shamrock #2: As served aboard the "Princess of Scandinavia".
Coconut Frappe: Shake or blend until frothy, then pour over ice and garnish with toasted coconut.
White Spider #2: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into cocktail glass.
Lorraine's Delight: We created this by mixing all of the ingredients we had available in Lorraine's kitchen. You may need to adjust to your personal taste but it is quite delicious. The peach schnapps give it a wonderful flavor.
Pit Bull on Crack #2: Mix all three ingredients in mixing tin with ice. Serve in a shot glass.
Buttery Nipple #3: Pour schnapps into shot glass. Carefully add Baily's to surface. Don not mix.
Radler: Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).
Tropiflipano: The drink was discovered by a group of malcontents at Colorado College wasting away a snowy eve (by being wasted). It was named after the primary ingredient and a filipino contributor who christened the drink that night, and a toilet the next day. We take no responsibility for individual results. P.S. We do not recommend inhalation of fumes.
F-69: This great shot was invented when we felt there were too many shots with uncommon ingredients. This has common ingredients and goes down smooth and quiet but when it hits your stomach a warm sensation may be felt.
Cinn's Stop Light: This doesn't come out in the order of a stoplight, because of the weight of the ingredients, but that is what we originally called it. This is rather sweet, but good! An old bartender friend, made it for me, because I don't care for drinks that taste like alcohol. Thank you, Chris!
Quick Fox: Layer each ingredients onto one another
Sol Y Sombra: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is "Sun and Shade", and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)
Gin And It: Stir gin and vermouth in a cocktail glass. (No ice is used in this drink.)
Super Allez: This is a very tasty drink formulated by a WVU student who was a little lit and had a few too many ingredients laying on his desk. A favorite of all of the First North boys.
William's Rainbow: high ball glas fill it with ice. poor vodka over the ice, then fill up with sprite. poor slowly 1cl blue curacao, after that poor 1cl grenadine. Ready to serv. The guest will now stir it and the drink will turn purple.
Cherry Godet: Godet is a really rich and sweet liqueur so you probably won't want to drink more than one of these. Try Godet on ice instead of dessert!
Hurlyburly: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Black Cow #2: You wouldn't think Kahlua and cola would go together in a drink, but this is good.
Peppermint Pattie: fill glass with ice pour creme de cacao and the creme de menthe over ice. stir and enjoy. Is best after dinner but can be enjoyed anytime.
Tie Me To The Bedpost #2: Shake well with ice. Pour into a highball glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Milwaukee Stop Light: WARNING: I like the liquers, if you don't I wouldn't suggest it, but it'll knock you off your feet. I find it best to do at last call just before calling a taxi
Freight Train: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass
Three-Legged Monkey: Shake and strain, into rocks glass.
Demon Drop: A nasty little drink guarenteed to mess you up with cheap and deadly everclear. You'll herdly taste the Everclear so it is easy to do 5 or 6. One shot equals about a beer or a beer and a half.
Rumka: Mix it half and half and serve chilled. Enjoy!
Chocolate Buzz: Start with the chocolate milk, next stir in 2 shots of Kahula and 2 shots of Irish Cream. Serve cold.
Tootsie Roll Float: Pour all over ice, mix and strain off ice..
Malibu Tequichi: Add some ice. Twist and shake that thing. Serve at once.
Shake That Ass: Can also be a drink, instead fill with sour and orange.
Pink Fizzy: It is just like a watermelon Jolly Rancher. Kind of a girlie drink. But I admire the men who drink it. *wink, wink*
Stinger Shot: Tabasco in the bottom of the shot. Pour Vodka and Crème de Mènthe gently on top. Shoot!
Dizzy Damage: This drink is known also as the "Dead Hitler": however it has become popular on the west coast as the Dizzy Damage. This drink is in legend to have been Dizzy damage's (Erik Boyles) drink of choice. (From the Glamour Punks).
Golddigger: Drink with another drinking budy,and do not forget to slam the glass on the bar when done,upsidedown
Algonquin: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Red Eyed Hell: Spicy and great treat for the grown ups.
Pentecostal: Add Bourbon, Vodka, then 7-Up in Wiskey Sour glass and stir.
Dirty Girl Scout: Mix the vodka, Kahlua and Bailey's and pour over ice. Pour the Creme de menthe down the center of the glass. Looks gross, but tastes delicious!
Killer Kool-Aid: Fill a cocktail glass with ice. Layer ingredients. Do not stir.
Sex on the Beach #10: shake like hell whith some ice
Grasshopper: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Anime Freak: Shake Tropico, Midori, Cranberry Juice, and 7-Up on the rocks. Serve in a glass with no ice.
Stabilizer: Chill the Rumple Minze until VERY cold. Then pour over the 151 in a shot glass. They will not layer, so don't try it. Then drink the shot quickly...don't waste time smelling the shot or sipping it...just drink it. The sit back and enjoy!
Stevie Wonder: Dark, rich, and smooth. My personal favorite. I made this myself
Green Hope: Created by Sven Aage Joansbråten, Norway. Winner of the 1979 I.B.A. international cocktail competition. Slightly modified from the original recipe.
Lemon Lift: Serve chilled straight or on the rocks.
Null & Void Punch: Mix with ice in a Tupperware dish pan. Serve in 16 oz glasses (with caution). Tastes great, but can lead to wastedness if comsumed too quickly, hence the name NULL & VOID punch.
Winter Tropic: We invented this on our last day of finals.
Atomic Watermelon: Mix ingredients in glass over ice and enjoy!
Lighthouse: Pour Kahlua in shot glass then with a spoon slowly pour Irish Cream into the shot glass on top of the Kahlua then pour the 151 Rum with the Spoon slowly on top of the Irish Cream then light on fire.. Blow out Flame Before Drinking!
Golden Margarita: Using a blender will work. Just don't blend it too long so you end up with a slush.
Flying Monkey: Makes a great drink at parties and is a big seller a shooter bars. BOTTOMS UP - SLAM IT BACK.
Asthma Attack: If asthma attack occurs, quickly follow with a Purple Motherfucker.
Caruso: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Sabra: I named this shooter "Sabra" after the Israeli chocolate and orange flavored liqueur Sabra.
Brain Damage: I created this drink while receiving some guests on a Saturday night.
Glow-Worm: This is a party drink. For however many people you are with (5 max.) get the same amount of straws. On the count of three, everyone sucks as fast as they can. The last one done buys the next one!
White Heart: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Slow Screw up against a Red Wall: Will taste much like a Slow Comfortable Screw up against a Wall, except less cherry and more fruit flavor. Hard to taste the alcohol in this if mixed well. Also try with 50/50 orange juice/pineapple juice.
Fernet con Coca: Put some ice in a cocktail glass. Pour the Fernet and then fill with coke. No mixing required.
Bob's Moscow Mule: Using a chilled cooper mug,fill with ice. Pour ingredients over ice. Garnish with sprig of fresh mint.
Southern Fruity Passion: This shot came from Matt Marder and Jon Fugitt. One night we were drinking we decided to make a new shot and there it was. The smoothest shot in the south, Southern Fruity Passion.
The Jack Hammer: Excellent birthday shot with a cool name!
Green Ferrit: All the way from Limerick Ireland. A cool drink!!!
Entwistle's Error: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Fart In the Ocean: Add tequila and chilled 7-UP to glass, drop in one sweet prune in each glass. Add ice if you wish.
Small Bomb: Serve as a shot or on the rocks.
Brass Monkey: Basically, toss the Rum & Vodka together and stir gently. Next, pour in the orange juice . Shake well. Pour over ice.
Fjellfinn: This drink is one created in the Royal Norwegian Cavalry and drunk mostly by officers at Setermoen in Troms. It's taste is quite good and the leaf adds a nice touch.
Columbia Gold: Taste's like a orange/strawberry slush with a hidden kick.
The Fucking Shit: The vodka is an estimate. The cranberry juice covers it up so you can really add as much as you want. the lemonade takes away some of the bitterness of the cranberry juice
Snowshoe: Pour peppermint schnapps in shot glass, top with Wild Turkey, drink it up!
More Orgasms: Stirr it together until it just looks like dark Bailey's.
Summer Tea: Make the tea and add all the stuff. Mix and enjoy.
Danbooka: pour it in and mix it.
Schnappster: Mix together and have a good time.
Frozen Mudslide #2: This is a shot from the hip on the ingredient amounts in this drink. It can be mixed together without the chocolate syrup and added later as a topping (lining the inside of the glass) and not mixed and served in a margarita size glass and served with whiped cream on top. This is very good!
Frenchie: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail or rocks glass and stir.
Wet Pussy: Vayr amount of milk to taste.
Warm and Fuzzy: Pour southern comfort, triple sec, and then cherry brandy
Nutty Banana: Its a very cool and tropical drink that is popular here in the northwest part of the states
Purple Haze #3: Add the Amaretto and root beer schnapps, then slowly add the milk. Next add the grape soda to change the color of the milk to purple.
Dirty Monkey: Mix in order listed. Do not stir. Serve in Brandy Snifter.
China White: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake, strain into shot glass.
Fuzzy Pusser: It might look like hell, but it tastes pretty good. This drink is a variation on a theme of a "Pain Killer" which comes from the British Virgin Islands.
Daylon's Bedtime: Pour vanilla vodka into ice filled glass. Add Triple Sec. Add Soda to taste. Mix with straw.
Cool Kid: put the shit in a hurricane glass, mix it up, and suck it down
Suburban Warhead: This is a drink for those who like it strong.
Siberian Sunrise: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender and pour into highball glass.
Cappucino Cocktail: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Bianca Pop: Pour coconut rum first then add amaretto.
Mocha Mint: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Coco Channel: Shake all with ice, serve in lowball over ice, or neat in a martini glass.
Eenytini: Pour blue curacao, gin and 7-Up into a shaker tin filled with ice. Swirl until tin is frosty. Pour into Martini (Cocktail) Glass. Repeat with the cranberry juice and add to glass so that an electric-purple colour is achieved. Garnish with a cherry on a sparkler stick.
Aloha Fruit punch: Add 1/4 cup water to ginger root. Boil 3 minutes. Strain. Add the liquid to the guava, lemon and pineapple juices. Make a syrup of sugar and remaining water. Cool. Combine with juices and pineapple. Chill throroughly.
Snowball #3: mix together into a double shotglass
Peach Bunny: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Vodka Grasshopper: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Martian Martini: This is a nice alternative to traditional Martini. The strong tast of the Midori cuts the bitterness of the Gin a bit (and makes the drink bright green). Just imagine how intrigued everyone will be when you walk around the party with a martini glass with what looks like antifreeze in it.
Rum Runner: For many drinks, mix in a punch bowl. -- Women enjoy the fruity flavor of this drink..(Malibu Rum has a coconut flavor). It does not have a strong alcohol taste and is a great pool side drink.
Damned if you do: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.
Dutch Flag: Layer. Blue curacao first, then pina colada and last grenadine on top.
The Shiwala: Remember that I warned you...Don't drink more than 4-5 of these or you are in BIG trouble the next morning! A.K.A. Jen's Rum Punch (Ft. Lauderdale/Palm Bch., Florida)
Flaming Giraffe: Inspired by my favorite painting, Girafe En Feu by Salvadore Dali
Harvey Cowpuncher: Same as Harvey Wallbanger. (Yes, it is MILK!! Believe it or not, it doesn't taste that bad) Say hello to Jan Henning, will you?
Applejack: Add all ingredients into mixing glass, chill and strain into cocktail glass
Umbrella Man Special: Invented this summer -97 on the party island Ios in Greece. A real party drink wich has a real good effect if you have problem to get in the mood
The Perfect Margarita #2: Incredible. Best mararita I've ever made. Sweet N Sour mix gives it a nice frothy look and taste.
151 Florida Bushwacker: Combine all ingredients. Blend until smooth. Garnish with chocolate shavings if desired.
Paralyzer #1: As a bartender in Kelowna B.C.Canada its one of the most popular drinks I make.I hope you enjoy!
Blue Edisonian: Put all ingredients into a shaker filled with cracked ice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Almond Chocolate Coffee: Pour in order into coffee cup. Top with whipped creme and chocolate shcvings.
Godchild: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
Pine-Sol Shooter: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass nearly filled with ice. Stir, and strain into a shot glass
Peekaboo: Pour Absolut Kurant and fill with orange juice.
Rugmuncher: Made as a companion shooter to the Cowboy Cocksucker.
Dea Lea: Shake all on Ice and strain into a Cocktail Glass. Serve on the rocks
Flamming Gorrilla Titties: This shot is a favorite at all my parties so try and enjoy it.
AJ's Bubbling Brew: This drink originated with me AJ at my house in Roseville CA one night i took my favorite drink, The Flaming Blue Jesus, and added a beer to it, and then stirred it up, and so was born AJ's Bubbling Brew. ENJOY
Texas Sling: Blend with Ice until smooth. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whip cream.
Brandy And Soda: Pour the brandy and club soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Thriller: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Cinnamon Toast Crunch: This is a delicious drink. Drink it with your girlfriend/boyfriend, or a close friend, with slow jams in the background.
Half & Half: An English-free version of the Black & Tan. Good for any true Irish boy or girl!
Hot Summer Breeze: Soak several slices of Habanero pepper in the bottle of vodka for 3 months before using. It will give you that feeling of a summer hot breeze.
Peppermint Beach: Mix with ice. Serve cold. [Our studies show this drink to taste quite foul at the beginning of the evening but rather refreshing after several other drinks have been consumed.]
Jamaican Qualude: This may also be made as a drink by adding more milk and serving over ice in a collins glass. A variation on this recipe calls for Kahlua in place of the Frangelico.
French Whore: Shake vigorously over ice and strain into a rocks glass.
Lunch Box #2: Mix the beer and OJ in a mug, drop the shot of Amaretto in, and down it.
The Liver Transplant: One of the house drinks at Sports Fans, A bar and nightclub where I work in Washington, D.C.
Montreal Club Bouncer: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve.
Golden Delicious: This is a great drink. We created it when we had the ingredients left over. One can alter the amount of cider to taste. The best glass to use is a solo cup. It's a very pretty drink and look great in a clear glass.
Dogg piss: Dump the ingredients into a container and stir it. It's very simple and very delicious.
Pimp & Hoe: Pour the liquor first, then the OJ and then the lemon juice. Stir the drink a little bit and then drink.
Flat Tire: Created at Giuseppe's in Meredith, NH. A great shot if you run out of Jägermeister.
Dutch turbo: It already won a price in Holland!
Uncle Sam: Pour three liquors in a shot glass. Better if chilled, prettier if layered.
G4: Absolutely amazing taste, somewhat similar to a B52 but much cheaper to make. Invented by a creative university who got tired of beer.
Pond water: Pour 1/2 bottle beer into mug. Fill rest with 1/2 can of Coke.
Climax: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.
Stevie Ray Vaughn: Shake ingredients over ice. Strain into shot glasses.
Bloody Coochie: Any kind of punch can be substituted for fruit punch.
Tequila Twilight: Adjust the amount of tequila for your own tastes.
Volvo: Mix in the order mentioned. You can use what ever kind of cognac, and vodka you prefer.
Light and Dark: Add sour mix and shake in whiskey sour rock glass or 10 oz. goblet. Garnish with lime wedge
Milk Tooth: Made by me one boring Monday afternoon at work at Brannigans Croydon. Remember I've been famous for years just show me the money.
Poppy Cocktail: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Kenny: Its a bit sweet of a vodka drink to be. Super
Cristianne: Feel the delicious flavor and see the beautiful color spectrum from red to blue.
Y2K Shot #2: The taste of this drink is sweet, very sweet, yet quite enjoyable. The color on the other hand is brown, somewhat the color of a rootbeer liquer. The history is all in the name, created by me and served on New Year's Eve 1999, also to toast in the New Year.
Hot Spot: Very spicey, Cool down with a beer. I got this drink from my halfbrother
Russian Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Royal Laundry: It comes out purple like a kings robe.
Pina Colada Punch: Chill pineapple juice and soda. Blend first four ingredients in a blender until creamy. (I've found a hand blender works very well since my blender won't hold all of this liquid or you could split it into two batches.) This can be done ahead of time and put back into the fridge until serving time. When your ready to serve, place coconut mixture in punch bowl, add ice-cream and allow it to dissolve somewhat. When ice-cream has dissolved almost completely, add pineapple soda. Add ice ring and decorate the frothy top of the punch with thin orange slices. If you wanted to make this alcoholic, cut back a little on the amount of soda and add a bit of rum - I like it with Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum.
Algae: Shake all ingredients over ice and pour into highball glass. No garnish.
Tiger Woods: Fill a highball with ice, add the vodka, lemon juice and cran. Garnish with a lemon wedge and serve.
Beadlestone Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Milk of Amnesia: This will taste like a delicious raspberry soda. Make sure you use a decent champagne but don't waste your money on expensive stuff. However I strongly recomend using Chambord. I know it hurts $$$ but the other (cheaper) brands never taste as good.
Hokkaido Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Horny Girlscout: Taste best when both ingredients are cold prior to being served.
The Sabino Special: This drink originated at the Crystal Cocktail Lounge in Montreal courtesy of its star bartender Sabino and thanks to the help of an inside source... Thanks again Amy.
Barbie Shot: A girlie shot for the ladies, and pink makes it perfect.
Rocky Mountain Bear Fucker: Pour into shot glass starting with tequila, followed by J.D. and finally Southern. Shoot it.
The Lindy: You can use Mountain Dew if you want.
B-52 #3: Layer the three ingredients in that order. And, I am terrible sorry, this is the only way to make a B-52 the right way.
Malibu Jane: Pour in Coconut Rum. Pour in Milk. Mix in two teaspoons of cocoa powder. Add one last teaspoon of cocoa powder: called "One to grow one." Let stand for one minute.
Winky: Add wink to gin, stir, add ice if desired.
Casey Special: Mix and Drink. Slam and Jam.
The Fuzzy Pissbomb: Pour all inggredients in rocks glass(with silver polka dots on it if ya got one) Stir. Watch it fizz for thirty seconds Drink it fast
Zool: Pour 1 oz. of Peach Schnapps in the shot glass first. Then pour 1 oz. of Absolut Vodka on top. Last pour Amaretto on top of Vodka until the Vodka changes in to a light brown.
Cinnamon Stick: My friends and I were experimenting with various types of drinks and this one was one of the best. If you like cinnamon, you'll enjoy this!
Death From Above: This drink is extremly harsh, so be careful with it!
Crap Schnapps: Notice the first letters of each ingredient. My own creation 20 years ago
Barbary Coast: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
The Beavis: Pour all the shit together, and hope it don't explode! Drink as fast as you can, with no food, and say your prayers.
B-69: Add ingredients to shaker with cubed ice, stir till shaker frosts, strain into rocks glass.
Frozen Margarita #2: In blender add the can of limeaide. Using the empty can measure the tequila and the triple sec and add to the blender. Blend, adding ice cubes until the drink becomes slushy and holds in peaks. Serves: 4
Honey Lemonade: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Amaretto Sour: Shake and strain. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice.
Black Cow #3: Pour Coke into glass of milk
Flaming Dr. Pepper (alternative): Put Amaretto in bottom of shot glass, top with Rum. Pour Beer into glass. Light shot, pick up shot by the sides and drop entire shot glass (bottom first) into beer. When bottom of shot glass hits bottom of beer glass chug (the beer will put out the flame).
Duke's Nightmare: Made by myself and the lead singer of the band Dukes Nightmare on Sept. 15 1999.
Black Forest: Like drinking a liquid Black Forest gateau.
McTavish: My brother, Todd, invented this drink. It serves the family name well.
Elephant Lips: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
French Monkey: Sounds revolting but it's actually exquisite
Caruso Blanco: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Snake Venom: It's barred from many a pub in Scotland
Killer Sniff: First, pour the Blue curacoa in the glass followed by the Sambucca. Then light this mixture. Let it burn for a few seconds and then put your hand on top of the glass (keep it on the glass) as soon as flames go out, bring the glass to your nose and sniff the alcohol. Then drink it. After this: relight the glass and sniff again. cheers!
Bazooka Joe: It tastes just like Bubble Gum and my guests like it for an easy shot.
Sour Death: Mix with ice and pour into glass.
Sparkplug: Shoot this shot and watch the sparks fly!!
Fuzzy Bullet: This is prerequesite before hunting "The Elusive Fuzzy Blue Gobbler" Be quick or it will get you!
Tiger's Milk: I personally cannot drink too many milk related alcoholic drinks...they don't settle well with me. But, if you can handle the milk, this is a very fine drink, indeed. Enjoy!
Wile E Coyote: Very refreshing drink after a hard day of chasing Road Runners!
Tie Me To The Bedpost, Baby: Mix with ice in a hurricane glass.
Butterfinger: fill glass with ice. pour butterscotch scnapps and bailey's into glass. fill with milk. shake. serve with sip straw.
Cherry Comfort: Pour about 4 oz of your favorite Cherry Cola into a cup. Add about 1 shot (1 oz) of Southern Comfort 100 (or 2 depending on how your college football team is doing). Ice is optional.
Purple Mask: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Wild Peppertini: This one is an old favorite at Attraction's Bar in Oxford, Ohio!!!
Dr. Pepper #3: fill shot glass with amaretto and gin. Drop shot glass into half glass of beer. Then, slam. It tastes just like Dr. Pepper (the soda)!!!!
Kill Me Now: Mix all ingredients in hurricane glass.
Blue Blazer #2: A warming drink on cold winter nights.
Milky Nooky: For a "Crunchy Nooky", add chocotale chip cookie crumbs (finely chopped) and chill over night in a sealed mason jar.
Robson Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
110 in the shade: Drop shooter in glass. Fill with beer
The Eclipse: Designed by a clever guy especially for the 1999 Solar Eclipse, this drink becomes darker if given time to settle - but can you resist it that long?!
Pink Panty Pulldowns #2: In a 2 gallon jug pour in 9oz of marciano cherries and the juice. Then pour in fifth of vodka over cherries and let soak for a few minutes. Then pour in lemon juice and fill jug with sprite. Pour mixture into serving container and strain out cherries. When serving drinks over ice drop cherries in.
Gagliardo: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.
Hurricane: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Mutual Orgasm: Pour ingredients into a pint glass half-filled with ice cubes. Alternately pour to another glass 3 or 4 times until chilled.
Bourble: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Screaming Orgasm: Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir. Caution: use only high quality vodka. Cheap vodka can cause the Bailey's to curdle. Test your brand of vodka by mixing 1 Tsp each of vodka and Bailey's first.
Pirate Float: Improvised this when certain places stopped serving frozen drinks (i.e. the original Pirate Float) over the winter. This one might even be better!
Fig: shake well, pour into shot glass.
PEZ: mix all three ingredients together over ice in tumbler. shake well. for shot, strain ice. for drink, retain ice. adjust sour mix ratio to taste.
Flamingo Punch: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Bavarian Alps: Shake together all ingrediants and serve in a frosted glass.
Elmer Fudpucker: Makes a nice fruity bevrage (despite the idea of beer and Sprite/Slice!). Best to sit down and enjoy an entire pitcher by yourself in one sitting, possibly watching the game, then stand up. This is not an original drink by me, I mearly passing it along.
Lewinsky: Pour together in shot glass and serve. Very easy to do.
Toby's Special: Created by the bar staff at Storrowton Tavern, West Springfield, Ma
Crackhouse: I discovered this drink (and Blackhaus) on a recent trip to the east coast. Thank you, New York.
Bitter lime: Pour 2 oz. Gin (seagrams lemon lime, best), over Ice cubes. Then pour 4 oz. of Lemon lime Gatorade. To finish pour 2 tbspn of lime juice and mix.
Duchess: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Scarlett O'Hara: Combine all three ingredients in a glass with ice. Stir and enjoy!
Evil Princess: Pour over ice. Stir and garnish with a lime slice.
David Caradine: As you have noticed, the drink is basically a grasshopper. It is named after David Caradine's role in Kung Fu--Kane, whose nickname was grasshopper. It's a grasshopper that will kick your .
Adios Motherfucker #3: Shake alcohol, then add sprite on top. Served on the rocks.
Terror From the Deep: Smells bad, tastes worse. If someone pukes after drinking this, you'll know where the name comes from.
Planter's Punch: Combine all ingrdients. Serve over ice in a collins glass. Garnish with lime wedge and maraschino cherry.
Far East: A new cocktail. One of my experiments.
Red Frog: Shake with ice and strain into glass with light ice, can also be served as a shooter
Irish Cactus: Tastes alot better than it sounds. I came up with this out of nessesity. The wife likes Irish cream and brandy and I like Tequila so I put the Tequila in her Irish Cream to try it out,Yumm. While traveling I asked a Bartender for Irish Cream and Tequila on the rocks and he said,"you whant what!? what do you call that"? I said, "I don't know what do you think it should be called"? The Bartender replied "Irish Cactus" and thats what I have called this drink ever since.
Is Paris Burning: Stirred, not shaken. Rocks acceptable. Fresh raspberry optional.
B-52 #1: Layer the Kahlua, Amaretto, and Irish Cream into a shot glass in that order. After drinking, notice the Vapor Trails.
Serial Killer: This drink got it's name because it looks normal, tastes normal, but you'd never guess it would sneak up and kill you.
Fatkid on the Rocks: Put the ice cubes in first then add the shots in the order that they're listed.
Watermelon Slice: This drink may already exist with another name, but not that i know of. I mixed it up one day and it tastes great.
Rock Lobster: Fill glass with ice. Add Razzamatazz and Crown Royal. Fill with Cranberry Juice.
Jack the Ripper: Buttershots takes away the bite to Crown Royal leaving a pleasant aftertaste unlike any other.
Triple Sec Sunrise: If too weak add more Triple Sec. It has a very sweet Tangerine flavor. It is ment for the more social drinkers then for Partiers. It is derived from the stronger drink Tequila Sunrise
Peachy Comfort: Fill glass Half full of ice. Add Southern Comfort and peach schnapps. Fill glass with ginger ale. stir and serve.
Drool: Drew Hull in Lawrence, Kansas thought of this great tasting drink.
Tweetie Bird: Triple Sec or Contreau may be substituted for the Grand Marnier
Fubar Kool-Aid: Mix in shaker over cracked ice, pour into highball glass with ice and enjoy.
Ebola: The name says it all. Don't expect to survive the next three days.
Man In A Man Suit: Try it without the fruit juice in shot form taking turns to fill your shot glasss' from the bowl. Originated in a military boarding school in Kent.
Deep-7: Can be made more powerful by adding more alcohol and/or less 7-up.
Sweet Maria: Shake all ingredients with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Ghetto Hell: This drink is an excellent choice for the "financially challenged." As unemployed college graduates, we enjoy this fine cocktail on a regular basis.
Nuts and Berries #1: In a ice filled mixing cup add all ingredients and shake well, pour into cocktail glass, garnish with berries in season
Almond Delight: Tasty. Another variation is using about three ounces Amaretto rather than 1/2 in an old fashioned glass on the rocks, which is nice if you like almonds. cheers.
Negroni: Stir over ice and pour into a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon zest.
Moonlight Drive: You can serve this in a glass, or as a shot. It is great for big parties. It has alot of alcohol to it, but it taste very fruity. I have had nothing but good responces, from a large sample of people ranging from 18 to 55.
Bananas and Cream: stir until ingredients are mixed well.
Massacre: Killer drink at parties. Very tasty and the aftertaste is slim to none, yet the buzz factor comes pretty quickly for a mixed drink. Enjoy!
Lusty Lisa: My friend Amanda and I invented this one! It should be done as a body shot. One person lays on the ground/bed/table/etc. with the shot glass held in his/her mouth. The drinker "mounts" the holder and must take the shot without using her/his hands! It's a lot of fun, and a great icebreaker!
Gooseberry Jam: Jam will never be the same again
Screw-Up: Fill glass with ice cubes, add all ingredients, mix then drink!
Frangeilico Float: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Serve in a highball glass and garnish with whipped cream.
Splurge: The lemon juice cancels out the taste of the vodka creating a citrusy taste sensation!
Nay-Nay Strohmeyer: Can't taste the alcohol at all, and you will be on the floor in a couple of drinks. Has a fruity taste.
Mithering Bastard: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Ultimate June Bug: Blend all ingredients and pour over ice.
Tummy Blower: Just Mix together and drink fast !!
Bullvodka: If you want to decorate, Use a red cherry on the bottom of the Glass. Be careful, it goes straight into your blood.
Absolute HB: Pour everything in a beer mug and shake it. Then you simply drink it.
Cinco de Mayo: This is a classic Mexican recipe for drinking Tequila. I don't remember where I learned it. I think it was a precursor to the modern Margarita. I didn't think Tequila & Grenadine would be a good combination, but the ingredients blend beautifully & this drink is outstanding!
Harlee's Planters Punch: measure light and dark rum into glass, add juices, grenadine...shake well, top with 151 rum... garnish with cherry and orange slice.
Japanese Slipper #2: Shake with ice in cocktail shaker. Strain into cocktail glass.
Absolutely Fruity: mix banana and watermelon liqueur in shot glass top with vodka.
Creamy Crispy Crunch: Relaxing smooth taste, can also be served hot with a dash of nutmeg for those cold evenings. Invented in 1998 by Mellissa Amadio.
Strawberry Sombrero: You may use your favorite flavored syrup instead of the strawberry syrup.
Dirty Mexican Lemonade: First add vodka to lemaonade, sprite goes in last. Stir.
Carjacker: Fill shot glass of Hennessey and then drop it into a pint of malt liquor.
Dead Hitler: Fill a shot glass equally in parts with Rumple Minze, Jägermeister, and Goldschlager.
Blue Moon: Another specialty drink from the Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas. Courtesy of Drink Specialist Tony Abou-Ganim.
Black & Tan: Fill pint glass half full with Bass. Next pour Guiness over a spoon slowly until glass is full. If done correctly the Guiness will stay on top and the Bass on bottom hence the name Black & Tan.
Shark Tank: Served at Norm's Beer and Brats, Superior, WI. Grenadine is poured into the mouth of a plastic shark, which is then placed tail-down in the drink. When patron is seated, they remove the shark and plunge it head-first into the vodka/lemonade mixture. Gives a nifty "blood" effect. Very sweet drink. Use caution with the straw, or the vodka will lay you out.
DeRosier: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Horny Bull #3: This drink should be drank with caution, as too many (ie. more than one)could be hazardous to the participant's health. These drinks tend to sneak up on a person. Even one who has only had one.
Warp Core Breach: Put 1/2 ounce of Goldschlager in 1 1/2 ounce shot glass. Then put Tequila on top followed by Jack Daniels. Down it and party till she's cute.
Hillinator: Mix the Captain Morgan, Mountain Dew, and sugar in one class. Pour the fire water into a shot glass. Take the shot, then follow it with the mixed drink. Make sure to drink the mixed drink quickly
Kish Wacker: Mix the ingredients in the blender with ice. Tastes like a chocolate shake. *Can add Bailey's to taste.
Russian Qualude #3: First ran into this in Reno Nevada after searching for the best B-52 in Reno. Bartender finished us off with a B-52 and adding the Frangelica and Vodka as two additional layers. Warning: This is a *very* potent potable.
Gimlet #2: Fill the glass to 2/3 with ice cubes. Shake the gin and lime and pour into the glass.
Skip And Go Naked #2: Pour beer into mug. Add lemonade. Float SoCo on top.
Southampton Slam: Serve in rocks glass - no ice - Pour both liquors, fill with club soda, roll once Serve with straw
Fuzzy Melonberry: Add all ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice
Mexican stand-off: Swish around in mouth several times before swallowing.
Malibu Bay Breeze: Mix ingredients and serve over ice.
Mint Gin Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Hudson: Revved up peach schnappes. The gin taste is not distinguishable.
Orange Bomb: Created by Jack Willard. Second place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
Tropical Pear Fizz: Not many liqueur based drinks out there that use pear or banana liqueur. This one is fun, light, and quite refreshing!
Double Intention: The consitency should be quite thick, so you can make an initial, or a love heart while pouring. I've served it to loads of people, but women tend to prefer it rather than men. Hope you like it.
Leprechaun's Gold: Created by Joe and JR on a random Tuesday night at 5 am.
Godiva Chocolate Martini: Tastes like dreamy chocolate milk. Enjoy, pure heaven.
Mudslide #4: The frozen mudlside is great in the summer, came across this mix in St. Martin several years ago. Tried the mix straight up later found it even better. The addition of Grand Marnier adds a little something extra. At a bar, they do not add Grand marnier, so ask for a B-52 with a shot of vodka.
Combustible Edison: In a shaker full of cracked ice, combine Campari and lemon juice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Heat brandy in a chaffing dish. When warm, ignite the brandy and pour in a flaming stream into the cocktail glass.
Fill shaker with ice, add ingreidients to taste. Don't want rum to overpower. Shake well, pour into shot glasses.
Mage's Fire: This drink is a favorite of The Royal Chessmen's and most of the performers we know from the renaissance faires.
Yin-Yang: Layer white chocolate liqueur over coffee liqueur. Enjoy.
Executive Sunrise: Pour the tequila and the orange juice into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Drop the cassis into the center of the drink.
Moon Pie: This Moon Pie shot is so good, you'll want a RC Cola on the side! Yee Haw !
Jamaican Sunset: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
1-900-FUK-MEUP: Created by the bar staff at TGI Fridays, Tallahassee, FL.
Hop, Skip, and Go Naked: You will posetively get drunk if this is drank through a straw.
3 Wise Men: Tastes like chicken, only with hint of liquer!!
The Bartman: Drink originated when a few of my friends through the alcoholic ingredients into my Dew, it was one of the first alcoholic drinks I had.
Anton's Ecto Cooler: Should taste like hi-c ecto cooler. Also works great as a shot.
Bruised Heart: Pour all ingredients in a mixing tin over ice, stir, and strain into shot glass
Dick Wells: Fill shot glass 2/3 full with Bailey's and then top it off with Crown Royal.
Sweet Satisfaction: Fill highball glass with ice and combine ingredients, stir and enjoy.
Grapeschlager: This one was created on a boring night. Suprisingly, we all liked it!
Russian Qualude #2: Pour over ice, shake vigorously, Strain into martini style cocktail glass. Garnish with one filbert.
Pjolter Bay: Have it all in a shaker, add 50/50 Fanta orange/Lemon mix. Sahake. Serv in highball glass. garnish with lemon an cherry.
Strawberry Soak: Invented by a baker from Hawaii. Created as a by product while marinating strawberries for a dessert. Serve shaken on the rocks with no ice.
Double Pucker: Tastes like a watermelon and apple jolly rancher sucked on together. I was on the drinking side of bar and was trying the sour apple pucker, then a the watermelon pucker and thought they might be good together (especially since there is only 15% alcohol in them) and low and behold it was GREAT now everyone where I bartend (the locals anyway) like them as well and the rest was history.
Mortuary Mix: This drink gets better the more errors you make in the "add everclear" part of the recipe. This will get you drunk very quickly and the wonderful taste of the collins mix kills not only the taste, but the smell of our good friend everclear.
Submarine (Mexican): This is a real strong drink even if it doesn't look like it. It is prefered that you drink it on one big gulp.
Bob Dylan: Combine all ingredients in a blender, mix until smooth. Be careful surge is carbonated, it will foam up. Enjoy!!!!
Victor: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sleigh Ride: Float the ingredients in order by pouring over the bottom of a spoon.
Calypso: Fast shot for a cold night warming sensational feeling! Try it, Love it!
The Better Fuzzy Navel: Mix ingredients together, then freeze drink until slushy (usually 2 hours) serve in highball glass, and enjoy!
Carl Johan: Mix. Top with Schweppes. Garnish with lime slice.
3rd Street Promanade: This is an incredibly delicious drink, like an alcoholic orange sherbert. Its a great party drink, and a great kickback drink.
Finnish Passion: Shake all ingredients,pour in longdrink glass. Garnish with a boat of orange and red cherry.
Storm Trooper: Inspired by the Star Wars series.
Chocolate-Mint Martini: Creme de menthe and Creme de cacao amounts may be vaired depending on taste.
Woo Woo: Pour all ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve.
Tokyo Rose: Mix equal parts in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Sackville Surprise: Rum first, syrup second. Mix well in shot glass.
Cherry Rum: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Ice Cappuccino: You can add a dash of nutmeg or cinnamon on top.
PB&J;: Combine all ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake and strain into shot glass. Serve.
Peach Tart: Made by Ryan O'Reilly at his bar "Foggy Notion's" in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, Canada
Damn Good!: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota
El Bastardo: One time, I drank 18 El Bastardos at a party in less than 2 hours. I woke up three days later in Pakistan with amnesia and a killer hangover, but it was worth the trouble! I had quadruple tunnel-vision for 4 days afterward, plus I couldn't put together a coherent sentence.
Unabomber: Before ingestion, grab large, stable objects to support you. This drink came from a failed attempt at kamikaze's... in retrospect, mission accomplished.
Presticles Spectacles Wallet and Watch: Origin, University of Wisconsin-Stout, Courtesy of Jon Prest
Sake Bomb: It's real easy. Drop the shot of Sake into a glass of beer and the just SLAM IT !!!!!!!!!!
Angel Face: Stir all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Kick me in the Jimmy: Combine in mixing tin with ice, shake and strain.
Stone Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
155 Belmont: Blend with ice. Serve in a wine glass. Garnish with carrot.
Mix all ingredients in tin over ice. Strain into shot glasses and enjoy!!!!
Dreamsicle #2: Shake and Strain contents into a highball glass filled with ice. Tastes just like the popsicle
Apple and Cinnamon Joy: This drink is a taste sensation to be reckoned with. Created on a late night by some college students.
Island Jack: This drink is very tropical. It comes from the TGIfridays franchise.
Fat Box: This is a favorite shooter of ours at Sports Fans in DC. It should be a green color.
Pimp Punch: Good party drink! Brought to you by the Pimp Squad, Berkeley, California, on a lonely Saturday night!
Glitch: Mix in order listed. The blue splash at the end makes the drink aquamarine colored, which is lovely.
Horny Bull #1: Not for the faint of heart, but definitely for the weak of mind.
The N8er T8er: Combine cream soda and gin. Stir well
Lara's Russian Qualude: Can also be reduced to serve as a shot.
Groader: Aaron attempted to make a White Russian one night, but in his drunken stupor he was unable to find any milk. Therefore he added ingredients haphazardly. Although he was unable to taste his creation due to his impaired senses, one Christopher Schrader was amazed by the sweet, smooth texture. Variants: Frozen Groader
Tully's Nuts & Berries: Pour ingredients into chiller and pour into shot glass.
George & Ginger: Pour George Dickel over ice into a tall glass. Add Ginger Ale, and stir.
Beer Top: From the Island of Guernsey Channel Islands.
Black Bird Cider: Add the Cider to the liqueur. Serve Cold
Rambo Shot: keep both liquors cold and serve ina chilled shot glass if possible
Funky Filly: Mix ingredients and strain over ice.
Frisky: Drink these until they taste good, then you'll know your lit.
Black Unicorn: Pour in kahlua, then butterscotch schnapps. Layer Irish cream on top.
Candy: Fill a glass with ice. Pour the 151. Pour the Dr. Pepper. Pour the Amaretto. Stir.
Andrea's Colada Collision: Fill blender about 1/4 full with ice. Add all ingredients to blender. Blend to a smooth consistency. Serve in either a hurricane glass or a tall glass or goblet. Garnish with a pineapple spear is optional.
Weakness: The reason I call this weakness should be pretty clear.
Pierced Nipple: Shake with ice, strain into shot glass.
Raspberry Stupid: Mix Well. Drink. Repeat until stupid.
Ladies Sidecar: Shake well with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
A Splash of Nash: Drop shot glass with banana & melon liquers into a 9 oz hi- ball glass containing soda water and cranberry juice. Drink in one shot.
Ortensia: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into cocktail glass.
Juniata Juice: Add 1 shot rum to 12 oz beer, stir in 2 tbls lime juice concentrate.
Milky Way Martini: Combine all ingredients, mix, serve without ice.
Metropolis: In a shaker, combine Vodka and blue curacao. Chill until cloudy. Pour into martini glass. Tilt glass and pour in raspberry schnapps (will sink to the bottom). Float cranberry vodka on top. This will give you levels of color: red - blue - purple.
Rocky Mountain Bear Fucker #3: The taste is original and goes does fairly smooth, but for the weeker stomach a chaser of some sort is usually required.
Greek Lightning: When chilled, the Ouzo will turn milky white allowing the Chambord to turn the shooter purple. Very similar to Purple Haze, but with a Greek touch...
The Power of Milk: Stir sugar and vodka together. Add milk. Serve cold with a straw.
Coffee Grinder: Use rocks glass, this isn't a small shot.
Chocolate Cake: Fill glass with ice. Add vodka then all other ingredients. Stir.
Fuzzy Peachclari: Pour vodka, then orange juice, then peach schnapps. Drink.
Summer Splash: Mix together in shaker, pour into glass over ice. Lime juice can be added to taste. Makes 2 drinks.
Whitney: The Whitney was constructed by me for the purpose of helping a friend with his girl. She requested to get drunk quickly and so I went to work. A few moments later I dubbed my concoction The Whitney which is her name.
Sperm Whale: Created by Cheryl Loo @ Red Lion, Waikiki, Hawaii. Easy to remember by SPM WHL...S-outhern Comfort, P-each Schnapps, M-alibu Rum WHL-What Hawaii Likes (Pineapple). Named after a member of the Aloha Hash House Harriers drinking club with a running problem (Sperm Whale)
Fog Cutter: Shake all ingredients and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Top with a teaspoon of sweet sherry and serve.
Horny Mohican: Free pour each ingredient into a test tube or shot glass
French Martini: This is a great change from the traditional Martini!
The Double Team: This drink was concocted in an American University dorm room. Drink with caution, and always drink responsibly.
Geneva Convention: For the amount of alcohol in this drink it is amazingly smooth.
Lambada: Shake all indrigiens in a shaker on ice in poorthem on crushed ice in a fancy glass.
Dirty Irish Whiskey: Mix in a mixing cup with ice and shake. Pour through a strainer, and drink
Harry Boy: Just mix and use ice. Served cool.
Sex on the Pool Table: Over ice mix equal parts of each alchohol. Top with the grapefruit juice. Shake to blend.
The Game: For a "Strange game" add 1 oz vodka.
Neon Voodoo: I just made this drink one night with what happened to be in the apartment. These instructions should be close to what I originally made but I was too messed up to remember how many ice cubes I added etc. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!
The Green Wave: pour all ingredients into shaker with ice. Chill and strain into glass. Serve immediately.
Sand In Your Crack: I am a bartender and was asked to make a "sex on the beach" for a customer. My bar was out of the raspberry ingrediant so i improvised a bit. I told the man that if you had sex on the beach, you would have "sand in your crack!"
Taco-Mancer: This drink was invented when, surprise, the dishes were dirty, and all I had was my huge-assed coffee mug with a shot of espresso left in the bottom. I put everything in, and Wow! Don't let the ingredients scare you, it's marvelous!
Sloe Vermouth: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Summit County Suicide: As strange as it sounds, it's good. Invented by a group of us partiers in the mountians in colorado. Summit County suicide was invented to get you really drunk, without making you sick, or making you gag.
Izayoi: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve. (Name mean: 16th moon in Japanese)
Wayne's World: Fill the shot glass about 2/3rd's full of Jager, and then top it off with the Sambuca.
Robin's Nest: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Bourbon and sprite: Pour the bourbon into the highball or whiskey sour glass with some ice. cubes preferred then mix the rest of glass with Sprite or Seven up.
Bayou Backwater: It looks like the backwater in a dirty river, but it tastes great. Use high quality lemonade or fresh lemonade if available.
Gorilla Snot #2: Layer the creme de banane over the melon liqueur. Then drop the Advocaat into the middle of the creme de banane. The Advocaat should hang in the middle if poured correctly.
Starla's Waver: This drink is only for people who have experience with alcohol, do not drink it if you hate hangovers or get drunk easily, believe me this will make you very drunk!!!!
Banshee: Combine ingredients with crushed ice in a mixing glass, then shake & strain into a cocktail glass.
Brutal Hammer: Put them in a glass; Pray to God; Then slam it!!!
Sunding Over the top: Created by some of the staff at O'learys restaurant in Östersund, Sweden.
Sweet Sunset: Fill blender cup with 15 ounces of small ice cubes, add rum, passion fruit syrup and sweet and sour and blend until smooth, in a hurricane glass pour the blended strawberries, then add the blended mixture, the strawberries will ooze up the sides of the glass and it will look like a beautiful sunset. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a cherry.
Silk Panties: Combine over ice, strain into shot glass.
Little Black Devil: Our regimental drink, easy to drink.
Sex On Acid: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain. Serve as a shooter.
Screaming Purple Jesus: Don't drink to many of these, or you won't remember what you've done the next morning!
Sir Francis: First, pour all 3 vodkas over ice in highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with grenadine, shake & serve.
J. R.'s Godchild: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the boubon, amaretto, and milk. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Great Grapes: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Gingerbread Man #2: Mix the ingredients with ice in a shaker and pour in glass.
Black Cactus: Pour Tequila and blackberry brandy together. Add club soda. Drink like a shooter.
Zorbatini: Prepare like a Martini. Garnish with a green olive.
Mexican three wise men: Serve straight up, on the rocks, or as one hell of a shot
The Velvet Kilt: A smooth and buttery cocktail with just enough scotch to bite back.
Batida de Coco: Blend well and add crushed ice.
Greasy Swede: This drink was invented by two good friends: One a Greek and the other a Swede trading shots at a the Bali Hai in Potsdam, NY.
Cruz Azul (Blue Cross): Name originates from a Mexican soccer team: Cruz Azul. -- This shot has an extremely strong mint taste, and when consumed through a short straw, is on the potent side. Not meant for the weak at heart. Enjoy. -- Credit for the drink belongs to a good friend of mine, and a fine bartender. Thanks Fabian.
Golden Blizzard: A good christmas drink. -- Use Peppermint Super Schnapps, a 100 proof schnapps made by Arrow.
Tequila Bom-Bom: Place a coaster on top, pound on table twice, guzzle it!
Ooo: Best with a no-pulp juice. Yet another Carnegie Mellon fave.
Green Motherfucker: Hang on to something with one hand. Slam it with the other.
Abe's Tropical Night in Hell: Based on the drink Abe's Tropical Night while watching the Crocodile Hunter!
Hot Georgia Peach: Chill and pour in shot glass. Serve.
Nut Case: Amaretto is made from almonds, frangelico from hazelnuts, hence the name.
Voodoo: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.
Black Bitch: Q: how many trashed blokes does it take too chate de chate de chaytch? A: Two!! -- Steve and Simon@British Embassy Rock Bar, Redhill, Surrey, England .
Iced Coffee: Mix together until coffee and sugar is dissolved. Add milk. Shake well. Using a blender or milk shake maker produces a very foamy drink. Serve in coffee mug.
Hunka Hunka Burnin Luv: Pour all ingredients into a glass (larger than 12 oz.). Put a lid over the glass. Shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
Pineapple Bomb: Very Sneaky drink if prepared properly. tastes great with a decent punch after a few...
Tropical Martini: Tastes great! I came upon this drink in the wilds of northern South Afica. Not really, I made it when I was drinking with some friends. I liked it, and so will you (barring any objection to either ingridient).
Liquid Snickers: E-mail and let me know what you think.
Grand Blue: Serve in an old fashioned glass.
Malibu Massage: You may also build this cocktail if required. This drink is a great alternative to a Pina Colada or a Chi-Chi.
Fire Engine With Alarm: Pour it in a highball glass. Should be severed Cold. Also use Ice if preffered. Realy the same as an Fire Engine.
Hazelnut Martini: add ingredients into mixing glass, chill and strain
Mocha Maria: Half fill a shaker with ice. Add ingredients, shake, and pour over ice.
Blue Diamond: Named for the Blue Diamond squadron at NAS Lemoore
Killer Bee: Pour both liquors in a shot glass.
Fruity Vodka Beverage: Pour ingredients over ice in a large glass.
Hot Apple Pie: Mix Tuaca and Cider in a large microwavable mug. Heat on high for 2 1/2 minutes. stirr again, and enjoy!!!
Soul Kiss Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Liquid Cocaine #3: There are other versions that go by this name, but as far as I know this is the most popular, and certainly the best. It is also the "unofficial" drink of Dragoncon convention goers in Atlanta Ga.
The Original Margarita: Mix in a shaker with ice. Strain into a salt rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish: lime or lemon slice
Tirade: Takes a 2 oz shot glass. First put in the triple sec, then tequila, last the spiced rum.
Buzzard's Breath: Tasty for a shot, and the shaking with ice calms the overwhelming stun of room temperature peppermint schnapps with anything lol. Bottoms up, and enjoy!
Southern Suicide: The grenadine syrup is what gives this drink a unique taste. Cheers.
Blue Banana: Pour creme de banana into the glass and layer blue curacao on top.
Carolina Kamikaze: The most popular drink on Franklin Street! (Go Heels!)
Greek Sex On The Beach: Put all ingredients in together, and shake. Serve in a glass filled up to 2/3 with ice.
Russian Shamrock: This is the type of drinks you get when put a Comrade and an Irishman behind a bar!! Shoot it and then swap "Fish Stories"
Captain Pepper: Mix. Then drink. Repeat as necessary.
Oil Slick #2: A great night starter. Dont forget that this is a shot so it must go down in one gulp. Feel it oooze.
Super Sprite: First drink 1/4 of the Sprite and fill up the 1/2l bottle with Hammer Lime vodka and drink!
Bee Stinger: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Terminator: This drink was created at Stratton's, Los Angeles, CA. It's now gone but this drink was too good to forget.
Chocolate Black Russian: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.
All Night Long: Mix all together in hurricane glass. Shake well. Garnish-orange flag
Caribbean Queen: Fill glass with handful of ice and add ingredients. Then mix.
Affirmative Action: fill glass about 1/4 with chilled orange juice. add vodka at a 2:1 ratio with cognac and add to highball glass with orange juice. optional squeeze of lemon.
Red Hurricane: Goes down very easily, and gets to work immediately. Be careful with this one!
Curtain Call: This drink is suprisingly smooth tasting. The sweet Midori taste balances out the slight harshness of the Jack Daniels and Jägermeister. Very good and easy to drink.
Electric Fuzzy: This is also good fixed in a punch bowl for large groups.
Chi Phi: This is the official shot of the Chi Phi Fraternity. Try it, you might like it!
Cran-Collins: The mix of cranberry juice and Collins mix covers the taste of vodka very well. This is an excellent drink!
Bahama Todd: Add light rum, dark rum, spiced rum, and malibu rum to ice filled glass. Mix in pineapple juice and blue curacao. Float 151 rum on top.
Greyhound: Pour ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)
Wild Thing: Pour over ice into old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Mike Tyson: Mix it and serve with ice
Broken Down Golf Cart #2: This shot is from Outta Bouns in Banff, Canada!!
Joy-To-The-World: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Zimartini: Takes away Zima's sweetness and gives it more kick
Green Hell #2: Mix all ingredients in shaker. Fill with ice and add orange juice. Pour into hurricane glass and serve.
Feel like holiday: Stir Vodka and Grenadine with ice. Fill in Champagne-flute without the ice. Fill up with champagne.
Royal Temptation: Created by George Liddle, Great Britain. Winner of the 1993 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
Surgedriver: Mix ingredients and pour into highball glass over ice
Electric Marcucci: Another hit from Carnegie Mellon. Invented in honor of the new master electrician of the drama department. Whiskey is his drink of choice, the melon helps smooth the edges, and anything with "electric" in the title HAS to be blue of course!
Party Slush Punch #3: Mix the following ingredients together and freeze. When slushy, drink as is or mix with 7-UP.
Prarie Fire: Pour one shot of tequila into the glass. Add Tabasco to taste
Adios Motherfucker (A.M.F.): Pour all ingredients except the 7-Up into a chilled glass filled with ice cubes. Top with 7-Up and stir gently.
Angry Chameleon: Disolve kool-Aid in rum. Add Mountain Dew.
Flaming Asshole: Drink fast with a straw. If you are slow your straw will burn. Be careful!
Tainted Heart: This drink is a classic to the old mint chocolate flavor usually found in ice cream.
Sweet Tarts: Add all into Shot glass. Slam the shot glass down as to mix up the ingrediants and give it a fizz. Then just drink it down and enjoy.
The Berserker: Pour shot of Amaretto into glass and fill with pineapple juice. Mixing is optional.
Scooby Snack #1: Shake ingredients in a mixing cup with ice. Strain into 7 oz. rocks glass and serve.
Kermit: This cocktail won 1st. price in the 1994 Bartender Club of Iceland, cocktail drink competition.
Orgasm a la Denmark: Stir it together until it just looks like Bailey's.
Sloe Tequila: Combine ingredients with a half-cup of crushed ice in blender. Blend at low speed and pour into old-fashioned glass. Add ice cubes and twist of cucumber peel.
Orange Demon: Pour the OJ first, then mix in the Everclear and the Cointreau.
Loch Ness Monster: Layer in order shown, Midori, Bailey's, Jager.
The Feckin Bolox: take the galliano and fill one third of the glass. then using a table spoon measure out the bayleys and pour onto the galliano, so that they are seperated. finally, clean the spoon, and measure out the coinraux pour onto the bayleys again so that they are seperated. take a match or lighter and light the cointraux, take a straw and place at bottom of glass and drink.
Passed Out Naked on the Bathroom Floor: Pour each ingredient into the shot glass, in this order: Rumple Minze, Jägermeister, Jose Cuervo Gold Tequila, then Bacardi 151 Rum. No need to mix, it mixes fine in this order.
Blueberry Tea #2: Pour amaretto and grand marnier in the glass Add hot tea
A Day at the Beach: Shake Rum, Amaretto, and Orange Juice in a shaker filled with ice. Strain over ice into a highball glass. Add Grenadine and garnish with a Pineapple Wedge and a Strawberry.
Midnight Cowboy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Fat Cat: I work at a restuarant as a bartender and there is a waitress who is from Turkey. She can not speak English very well so she often orders drinks mispronouning them. One day she ordered a fat cat on the rocks meaning vodka on the rocks. So the manager and I decided to invent a drink called a Fat Cat.
Mandarin Metropolitan: You may need more or less of the Rose's lime juice. I find it kind of bitter, and use less when I am making this drink.
Pear Martini: Garnish with a slice of pear.
Start Me Up: This is a result of one week of hard partying and the only things left was vodka, tequila, absolut kurant and dark rum. I figured, what the hell... Taste it and tou'll love it!!!
Strawberry Shivers: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Duck Fart #2: Pour Crown in first...Then the Kahlua, and Float the Baileys on top. Then Slam!
Forza FCK: This is a tribute to the best footballteam (soccer) in Denmark!
Brevann (Springwater): Everything goes in a highballglass with ice. Pour Seven Up or Sprite on the top Garnish with lemon and some other fresh fruit. Drink with a straw
Spiced apple: In a shot glass pour in apple brandy first, then Goldschlager, then Captain Morgan's. Shoot!
Insomniac: You can add nutmeg or cinnamon on top.
California Gold Rush: This drink looks very pretty because the bubbles of carbon dioxide in the 7-up continuously move the gold flakes around.
Butterball: Add Amaretto first and then layer Butterscotch schnapps on top, don't mix. Add whipped cream if desired.
Peach Death: Pour ingredients on the rocks and enjoy.
Jack Rose: An old family recipe, which we generally serve as a festive drink prior to holiday dinners. For mass production, I find that a fifth of Applejack, a 12 oz. bottle of grenadine, and eight lemons work well. Use only freshly squeezed lemon juice for best taste. Enjoy!
Lunch Box: Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.
Agent Orange: Hurricane glass filled with ice add ingredients shake cherry and orange garnish
Pimp Cocktail: This drink is a combination of the peach and orange flavors but is a bright green color. A very festive drink indeed! -- Also known as "The Knightrider".
Burning Nazi: Keep bottles chilled or mix over ice and strain into shot glass.
Sex at my House: Everytime I ask "How was the sex!", I get "Great!"
Faust: Careful with this one, it may make you sick: but if it doesn't, you'll be fine until the next morning. Don't drink to much of this one!
Blue Moon Martini: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Lewd Lewinsky: The Professional Bartenders School in Chicago (529 S. Wabash) held a Monica Lewinsky drink contest in its afternoon and evening classes with instructor Kim G. This was #3.
Ponderosa: Throw it all into a glass, shoot as fast as possible. Do this repeatadly until very inebriated!
Italian Sunrise: This is a house specialty drink from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Mexican Flag: Layer Drink: Using spoon, pour shot over spoon over glass. Fill with Grenadine first, then Creme de Menthe, and last but not least Tequila. The layers form the mexican flag enjoy.
Passion Beach: My contibution to all those who dislike "Sex on the beach", a very fresh and fruity drink!
Quagmyre: Add ingredients as shown in any order. Shake until drink becomes clear.
Orange Kiss: Mix vodka and Orancio, add Sprite and garnish with a slice of orange.
Black Death: A great tasting shot, that looks fancy, and does not require a chaser!
The Rollercoaster: This drink may not sound all that great, but believe me it is a wonderful ride. It was created at the University of Dayton during a cast party after an original show called Rollercoaster. Enjoy the wild ride!
Frisky Witch: I found this on the internet somewhere, and had it last New Years...VERY nice, and smotth to boot =)
Leap Year: Created by Harry Craddock at the Savoy Hotel in London, in the late 1920s. Is said to be so smooth that you are easily lured into having one too many :)
Opera Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Parisian: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Panther: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over several ice cubes. Stir well and serve.
Green Spider: Shot of 151 first then Creme de Menthe.
Purple Mexican: I invented this drink at a bar called ETC. in Memphis, TN in the mid 80's. All you taste is the Grand Marnier. Doesn't take many. Have a nice trip.
The Celt: Tattoo is a blueberry schnapps that leaves a blue coloring inside your mouth, do NOT get any on your clothes it won't come off. Most people will only drink 1 or 2 of these
Jay In Your Tummy: Warning: Too much Sambuca will overpower the other ingredients and ruin the shot.
Tubboocki: Origin: Yannis Villa, Sidari, Corfu, Greece. Taste: Very Warming. History: Just when we thought we couldnt think of any more shooters up poppped this one into our twisted brains. Thanks to Tellis (Holiday From Hell Fame) for lending me his bar. Tubbooki is Greek for blow job.
Army Green: Made popular by the US Army Military Police stationed on Johnston Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.
Manhasset: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Choclate Banana Martini: Fill mixing glass with ingredients, stir and pour into chilled martini glass. Add Hershey's kiss or Godiva choclate for a garnish.
Mudwrestle: mix in shaker, serve over lots of ice
Bourbon County Cowboy: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Key Largo OJ: Add ice and then equal parts of Key Largo and Orange juice. Mix and enjoy
Greenham's Grotto: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Candy Corn: Although it doesn't taste like candy or corn, it looks like a candy corn. Origin unknown.
Irish Whip: The Irish whip comes from the small Island of Guernsey. It is drank on St Patricks day and any time Ireland is playing in a world cup soccer game.
Romulan Ale #3: Makes one huge shot or several smaller ones.
Welcome delight: Simple: Just put them into a bowl, and mix then together.
The Evil Blue Thing: This drink was invented by my friends, Nathan Smith and Dave Calam. Dave said "let's make a blue drink" and the rest is history. It's evil because it tastes like candy but packs a big alcoholic punch! It's a great drink, if a little on the expensive side.... The taste is like those orange ovation chocolates, only better (less orange).
Flaming Huscroft: Throw all in a glass, light it: When flame goes down, chug but make sure you have a chaser, or your in trouble.
Blindside: Drink should taste like ruby red grapefruit juice.
Blackjack #2: Shake all ingredients with cracked ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Owen's Grandmother's Revenge: Add ingredients and mix in blender.
King of Denmark: Stir the Pernod&Black;, add several big icecubes.
Carolina: pour strega into chilled wine glass, add champagne. Stir slightly.
ACID: It taste pretty smooth for having 151 & 101 mixed.
Applejack (Jack Daniel's original recipe: This is the recipe Jack Daniel's gives for this drink.
Red Snapper: One shot each, shake n shoot
Golden Coke: This drink was created late at night, by some college students.
Bomb: This drink is made to get a person very drunk very fast. Drink in moderation.
Italian Stallion: I do believe that this is my own creation. Try it, I think you will like it.
Purple Margarita: You can either drink this one the rocks or frozen. Salt to taste.
Veteran: Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Brain Eraser #2: Pour ingredients in shotglass. (Try it in a frozen shotglass.)
A joy of Almond: Shoot or suck with staw from bottom to top.
Haywire: Haywire is the name of my boat. This drink was invented at a boat warming party for my crew.
Green Quencher: Best when tonic and vodka are pre-chilled, but not over ice.
Formula 3: Add the 2 rums and vodka together in a beer mug. Then add the other 2 ingredients to it. Then top off the beer mug with lemonade.
