Captain Morgan's Steamy Applecolada Drea: This very tasty, and warms-you-from-the-inside-out adult beverage started with a request for Spiced Apple Rum at a holiday party. The bartender's interpretation of Captain Morgan's was Captain Morgan's 'Parrot Bay' vs. the spiced rum our favorite pirate is known for. We added the remaining ingredients anyway, and voila--a star is born.
Carlitos: Pour over ice in a tall glass. Stir.
Rebel Russian: Treat it like a white russian, but add some rebel attitude!
Muppet: This is a famous drink in all the beaches in Mexico
Watermelon: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a collins glass over ice cubes, and serve.
JEE Sweet: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker and serve in a chilled martini glass.
Pink Squirrel: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Aranov: Drink straight from the bottle. Rybb & Decker is great, 'cause it got the fruitpulp.
Sweet Tart - Loyalist Rez: You may wish to change messurements slightly, which is why it is best to mix large amounts. It actually does taste like the sweet tart you had as a child
Back-up Goalie: A buddy of mine and another goalie came up with this after being demoted to back-ups.
Mexican Clit: Mexican Clit brought to you by: Bill Drew Jeremy Tommy
Lime Lizard: Pour in Vodka first, then mix in the rest. Count to three and drink!
Alice in Wonderland: I mix a mason jar full at a time and keep it it the refrigerator. Pour when required and sip away.

Quick Fuck: Tipped back slower then a normal shot.
Hot Jose: Tastes better when Hot Damn has been chilled.
Highlander: Tell your moms not to drink this shit!!!!
Greenback: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Green Opal: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Banana Cream Pie #2: For a more creamy refreshment, blend with ice and half-and-half.
Blonde Bombshell: If the proportions seem a little strong feel free to change the amounts of ingredients as needed, or a few shots of water instead of some of the shots of rum. This recipe should make enough for 2-4 people, depending upon the size of your margarita glasses.
Christmas Cheer: stir it up and shoot it down. HO! HO! HO! Tastes like christmas with a pine tree twist.
Wet Crotch: Obviously using 1 oz. of each ingredient will make three 1 oz. shots. Add or lessen the amounts according to the desired number of shots. (Just remember to always use equal amounts of each.)
Centipede: Combine vodka and rum in cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into old-fashioned glass with ice. Top off with grapefruit soda and stir gently.
Tropical Peach Martini: Shake with ice. Strain into cocktail glass.

Mellow Tennessee: Pour Jack Daniels into highball glass. Add ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale and finish off by topping it with orange juice.
Vulcan Mind Meld: Pour ingredients into glass (usually a double shot glass.) Drink quickly.
Fria Cafe Italiano: Thanks to Tony Abou-Ganim for yet another fantastic cocktail!
Whisky Mac: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.
Scope #2: Place ice in a tin then pour 1/2 oz. of Midori melon liqueur and 1/2 oz. of Rumple Minze. Shake and then strain into a rocks glass.

Aperol Schuhmann: Shake with ice. Serve in a longdrink glass.
Poor Man's Mommosa: Pour Beer into a highball glass, add orange juice til desired color

Fruit Sensation: Fill glass with ice add all the ingredients- mix well add straw and garnish if required.
Lemonade Lush: This is good mixed in a punch bowl for parties too. Just remember, half of the drink is alcohol.
Falix: Pour the Baccardi into the shot glass. Add the Margarita mix. Top it with lemon juice and shoot it.
49er Gold Rush: If you want to get wasted fast, with less volume in a sweet and warm drink, this is the perfect drink for you. No drinking party should be complete without a shot of 49er Gold Rush!
Turlock Bulldog: This drink is submitted by Turlock high class of 1994 by Trevor Dewar.
Fuquay Friday Night: Absolute can be varied to taste and alcohol tollerance. Discretion is advised. Also a dash of lime can be added for a slightly different taste.
Purple Motherfucker: Combine first five ingredients in a mixing glass half-filled with ice. Shake. Pour into a Collins glass and top with 7-Up.
Sonoma: An infamous drink by TP from Penn State!
Chocolate Martini: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice then pour into martini glass
Frozen Blue Daiquiri: This is a new generation of Daiquiri. A very nice colour drink.It is about the same as other Daiquiri except for its colour only.
Red Rock: Mix vodka and schnapps in the bottom of a glass. Add ice and Dr. Pepper.
Cherry Bon Bon: Perfect for a Valentine's Day shot.
La Cafe: Created by Virgil Tropea. Third place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
Flaming Russian: Pour vodka in shot glass, carefully layer rum on top. Ignite rum and serve.
Sex on the Beach #11: This is a hell of a drink. I'm surprised that this recipe hasn't been added. It's the best kind. Had it in Europe.
Skinny Dipper: Mix ingredients and serve in a tall glass over ice.
Aztec Punch: Mix all ingredients in a pitcher. Mix thoroughly and pour into whatever is available, the bigger the better! This drink packs a big punch, so don't over do it.
G Bomb: Chill both ingredients by placing the bottles in the freezer for at least 1 hour. You should also chill the shot glasses you will be using the same way. Pour both ingredients into a chilled shot glass and enjoy.
Karsk: Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.
Antifreeze #2: Add vodka to glass over ice. Then add water and lemon lime mix. Stir until all is dissolved.
Merete: Stir all with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass, add the cherry, and serve.
Tiger Tail: This is a shot that, layered correctly, tends to resemble a striped tigers tail.
The Saint Lawrence: Stir, pour into plastic cup and chug!!!!
Aggravation: Fill a rocks glass with ice, then add Scotch and kahlua. Float cream on top and stir.
Naked Girl Scout: By adding the shot to coffee, a "Steamy Girl Scout" will be made.
Tripple Pleasure: dump it in a glass of ice and enjoy
Southern Peach: add all with ice shack and strain
Cranberry Frog: Add vodka for a Cranberry Toad, rum for a Cranberry Newt.
Key Lime Shooter: This is a favorite in Key West.
Snow White: Place Sprite/7up into glass. Pour Heineken to top off. Mixture can be varied. Good summertime drink.
Titty Twister-Rita: pour ingredients into blender over crushed ice blend until you see the top of the mix stop moving pour into margarita glass and garnish with a lemon or lime slice... (by the way, this makes 1 to 2 servings only) hope ya enjoy it...
Cement Mixer: Take shot of Bailey's. With Bailey's in your mouth take shot of lime juice. Mix rapidly in mouth by shaking head vigorously. Swallow before it congeals totally.
Caribbean Bliss: Use chilled orange juice, but no ice.
White Lightening: Garnish with a neon lightening bolt. White lightening is the signature drink of OLD GLORY, located in the heart of Georgetown in Washington DC. Ask for Fred and get a free White lightening! We also carry DC's LARGEST BOURBON SELECTION!
Whitecap Margarita: I found this recipe in a magazine and tried it on several friends and they all agree, it's a keeper.
Millionare's Coffee: This is a great drink for those cold winter nights when regular hot chocolate doesn't do the trick.
Hershey Squirts: Discovered by Hernan Barangan and Chris Newnan in Jan 1989
Absolut Stress #2: Mix well. Garnish with Orange and Cherry. Enjoy
Raspberry Cordial: Combine all ingredients and stir until sugar is disolved. Store in large bottles for 22 days, then put in gift bottles and seal.
Reptile: Make sure all ingredients are chilled. Add in order: ET, OJ, Dew. Stir lightly. Like most OJ drinks, the alcohol is hard to taste. A padded bar is recomended.
Cokaretto: Fill tall glass with ice. Pour Coca-Cola into glass. Add amaretto and stir. Drink with straw.
Kentucky Wildcat: From a small bar in DC. Random Bartender that a friend knew.
Grape Crush: Small shaker with ice add ingredients stir strain into shot glass
A Better Melonball: This is like the melon ball, only not quite as fruity.
Christmas Pudding: If Draught Guinness is not available chilled bottled or canned Guinness will do
The Jumpin' Black Jack: Invented (kind of by accident) aboard the Noordaam during the Bad Boys II Cruise. Sure it's sweet but if you like Jack and blackberries you'll love this. Wusses can add 7-up to cut it back a little.
Italian Ice: Shake Well - Do not stir. Best if served with crushed ice.
Blue Monkey: Tried this drink at Mardi Gras and it is one of the best drinks I've ever had.
Flageln: Pour the vodka into the glass first, then pour the Red Bull slowly into it. Add ice.
Rosita: Stir in old-fashioned glass with cracked ice. Add a twist of lemon peel and serve with short straws.
Upper Cut: Just like an irish coffey. Wait till it has cooled a bit. Drink all in one move.
Hologram: place ingredients into shaker with ice. shake and strain into shot glass
Flaming Moz: You can substitute just about anything for the blue curacao and white sambucca, as long as they flame. A mixture of blue and red Galliano Sambucca makes a particularly good looking drink. Try adjusting the colour to suit your customer. Ask customer "what's your favourite colour?", and make it that colour. Great for birthdays and similar celebrations. If you're soft, you could probably do it without the chatreuse.
Buzz Inducer: Put the two shots into frosty beer mug. Add IBC Root Beer into glass. Ice cubes are optional.
Russian Apple: This is a popular drink with the student population of Chico State in Chico California.
Black Velvet: Pour stout into a champagne flute. Add champagne carefully, so it does not mix with stout, and serve.
Desert Water: This drink wrecks your stomach...learned it from a soldier in the middle east who said it cures sore throats.....
Dead Dog Vomit: In a high-ball glass add 0ne shot of 151 rum and then layer each if the other ingredents on top.
Black Fog: This always reminds me of some sort of chocolate raspberry desert. If you enjoy a good stout, you'll probably love this!
Rolling Green Elixer: Combine ingredients in a shaker, strain ice cubes.
Egg Cream: Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.
Electric Storm: Combine all 4 ingredients into a shot glass and slam it.
Queen Elizabeth: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Between The Sheets: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Vesper: This drink was created by James Bond in the 1953 book "Casino Royale" by Ian Fleming. It is named for his femme fatale - Vesper Lynd - and Bond remarked: "I never have more than one drink before dinner. But I do like that one to be large and very strong and very cold and very well-made. I hate small portions of anything, particularly when they taste bad."
Abilene: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
Diablo's Blood: Pour both ingredients together and mix well. Serve cold.
Pineapple Bomber: Fill a glass with ice, then add amaretto and Southern Comfort. Fill rest of glass (at least 1/3 of volume) with pineapple juice.
Banana Cream Pie: Mix in a shaker with ice then strain.
Dog Biscuit: Can substitute 1 oz. root beer for 1/2 oz. root beer schnapps.
81 Camaro: Inspired by a rusty, black '81 camaro that frequents the Montgomery county fair grounds.
Baduizm: This cocktail was created in Buenos Aires, Argentina. My inspiration was listen the music of Erykah Badu her song Appletree.
Caribbean Ice Tea: Tastes like a Long Island Ice Tea, but with a Caribbean Sea appearance. Use Malibu Rum and you will think you in the islands. Hey Mon and Wo-Mon, enjoy !!!
Something Peachie #1: serve in a tall glass over ice garnish with a cherry and orange
Purple Yummy: Mix in cocktail shaker with ice cubes to chill. Strain into glass, adorn with cherries.
Bondages' No Problem: This is a version of a drink Johnny Bondage and I had in Jamaica. So get some reggae music on and have a few of Bondages' No Problem and get irie! It's no problem man!
Alice Cocktail: Shake well, strain into a large cocktail glass.
The Big-V: Try to layer in shot glass.
Bayou Juice: Pour equal parts of all ingrediants into a shaker filled with ice. Chill, shake and strain!
Roadkill: Pour all 3 ingredients into the glass and serve with a Coke back.
Greek Tycoon: This drink was made in Cresskill, NJ. Designed for the "Greek Tycoons" in all of us.
Party Slush Punch #2: Put the ingredients into a container in the freezer (stir occasionally while freezing). To serve: put 2/3 slush to 1/3 7-up in each glass or same ratio in punch bowl.
Hat Trick #1: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the dark rum, light rum, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Five dollar shake: "It may not be worth five dollars, but it's pretty f@#*ing good!"
Brittle Fracture: YUM! Tastes just like real root beer, kids. It's good for what ails ya. Created during Colorado School of Mines Engineers' Days 1993.
Gold Coast: Best if cherry juice is not pre-sweetened.
Mind Game: Abusing of this substance will rot your brain while leaving a pleasant taste in your mouth
Fourth of July: may also subtitute vodka for cream Stronger version
Poison Ivy: This drink was created while I had a case of Poison Ivy. It has a special meaning. The Kahlua stands for the poison, and the Aftershock stands for the body. When layered, the poison has been touched. When mixed, the poisonous oils have been drank.
Dead Nazi: pour rumple minze(should be pre chilled) into shot glass add jager(should also be pre chilled), serve
Carrot Cake #3: Recipe from Dr. Feelgood's, Conneaut, Ohio.
Sacrilicious: chill and strain into a shot glass
Chocolate Paradise: Simply pour over ice into a tall glass.
Lemon Highlander: Pour into scotch glass over ice. Stir. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.
Jewel Of The Nile: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Jens Special: A friend named Raine thought me how to make this, Once I tasted it I got stuck and now I allways drink it.
Green Eyes: Pour over crushed ice and stir or can be blended.
Apple Grande: For a party, 1 bottle tequila to 1 gallon apple juice
Low Lattitude Lust: The drink is supposed to have a light orangeish-pink color to it. When mixed properly, you will only be able to taste a smoothly sweet pineapple taste.
Caleigh: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Tuaca Nutter: Another great creation from Tuaca HQ in the UK.
Goldschlager Lemondrop: Recipe calls for Lemonade Mix, but I find plain lemonade works just fine. Cheers.
Tropical Itching: Shake with ice and pour into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of orange, a cherry and a sprig of mint.
Fruit and Sherbet Punch: Just mix all the liquids together, and float the sherbert in the punch just before serving.
Panama Deluxe: Shake all ingredients together, serve in a tumbler over ice.
FU2: If done right it will be the best drink you ever made
Chocolate Covered Cherries: Layer carefully using the back of a spoon. Grenadine first, then Kahlua and then Bailey's.
Hawaiian Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Villa Park: Mix bourbon, orange juice and pineapple juice in mixer. Shake well. Pour into highball glass with ice.
Rikkertje: Add some ICE Put in the shaker Shake your ass off
Toronto Maple Leafs: Some of my friends and I made up shots for different teams during the 1999 NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs. This shot signifies Toronto's colours - Blue and White.
Corpse Reviver: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Disco Ball: This drink can also be served without the chill, but cold tastes better.
Peanut Butter and Jelly: Just pour and drink. No chill.
Forgive Me: Stir with ice and strain to cocktail glass.
Yellow Cake: Learned it at work one night, and it really does taste like yellow cake. Very good for those "Fun Shots".
Tipperary Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Generation X: This drink is sooo tasty that Generations Y & Z won't be able to pass it up either!
Well Greased Dwarf: This drink was created in honor of my girlfriend Kathy King. The name "Well Greased Dwarf" came about from a clue that appeared in a NTN game at my bar. She thought that the phrase was funny enough to warrent a shot and I created this for her. It has since become something of my signiture drink at my bar & one that Kathy will frequently offer to new patrons.
Flaming Lamborghini: I know it seems a tad theatrical but bar customers do love the whole ritual of cocktails like this and it may sound strange but it is actually a very pleasant tasting drink.
Acid Rain: The taste of the Snapple masks the alcohol so well, you can hardly taste it! The perfect drink for those who have the tastebuds of a five-year-old girl, like me.
X.Y.Z. Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Jim Beam's Redneck Friend: Pour all ingredients in bowl and mix well.
Horny Toad: Layer each part in glass first: Triple Sec second: Kahlua third: Cream
Camel Hump: These were invented at Clancy's Sports bar in Azusa, CA.
Malibu Snapper: A really good friuty rum drink that was made by accident, by my best friend and I.
The Marv Alberts: Fill glass with 3 oz of Bailey's Irish Creme, then add 1 oz of Southern Comfort, followed by mixing in 1 oz of Buterscotch Schnapps.
STP (the motor oil of course): Add whiskyand vodka to glass of ice. Stir in maple syrup. Wait 2 minutes and enjoy.
The Big Robowski: If mixed properly, this drink is extremely smooth, with a hint of Cinnamon flavoring. I invented this drink about a year ago, in my second year of University, and have been making it for worthy recipients ever since.
Choad: Please email me if you find this drink to your liking, please see my other entries for similar interesting concoctions. Check your dictionary for the meaning of choad.
Opera House Special: Put all ingredients into a metal mixer and strain into shot glass.
Ishav: Shake vodka, Pisang and sour mix well with ice. Pour into a highball glass. Fill with soda water.
Schwimmer: Mix all ingredients together in mixer, chill, then serve in shot glass
Veterinary: Pour alcohol over ice cubes in tall glass. Add lime juice and Sprite / 7-UP. Stir well.
Prickly Pear: It has a nice taste - In New Orleans, it was primarily a Bartender's drink - Not too sweet, not too tart, and the effects of Tequila!
Mirage: A sweet cocktail to conquer a sweet lady. Created in Fregene, Italy by Tony
Dirty Diaper: This drink was invented by a friend of mine, (bulldog) it sounds disgusting, looks disgusting, but tastes great!
Vodkalenius: Stir all ingrediences with ice cubes and drink in a real Grogg-glass to get the wanted and expected effect. Let the lingonberry jam chill before mixing and make sure the vodka is below freezing to get a real lingonberry taste. One can us a straw if needed.
Three Day Weekend: A friend of mine who used to be a bartender introduced me to this drink. It's actually his creation, so many thanks to Clint Galliano!
Pink Passion: Nice pale pink color. A "summertime" drink
Photon Torpedo: Mix the Aftershock with vodka, in no particular order.
Scope: Tastes like mouthwash! (For Americans, think of mint flavored Zima (For others, Zima is a malt beverage that tastes like alcoholic soda))
Maria Theresa: Combine with ice. Shake. Strain and add ice.
666: Very hot and spicy. Will wake up your taste buds.
Apricot Smoothie: For a little different taste use apple juice instead of orange juice.
White Mess: Can also be made tall (add a little soda water to cut down on the cream). Tastes like an Almond Joy (candy bar) that has been dunked into a can of root beer!
915 Special: Conceived at Lake Manyara, Kenya. Named after a dorm room at the University of Washington, USA.
Finn Roses: G.Brandberg, F.B.S.K., Finland 3. I.B.A.s I.C.C. 1962 -- Category: Pre Dinner
The Crown Cherry: Mix all together in glass with ice.
Chiquita: This drink tastes like milkshake, and should be drunk several in line.
Applecar: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Poop Deck Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Neon Ghost: Shake it with ice, and serve it in a cocktail glass.
Afterbirth: Mix schnapps and grenadine. Add Bailey's last. Wait until the Bailey's curdles then shoot .
Golden Miller: Mix above ingred. together with LOTS of crushed ice. Enjoy!
Green Dinosaur #3: Stir ingredients in ice and strain into a shot glass.
Rum Runner #2: This is the original recipe that hails from the Holiday Isle Tiki Bar in Florida Keys
Gorilla Fart #2: Just add the 2 ingredients, and shoot it.
Zooom!: Ideally this should be served in highball glasses that taper to a point on the inside, so it looks a bit like zoom ice lollys shoot it
Green Hell: Pour both into glass and keep away from open flames!!
Green delight: Just mix all the ingredients. It is also best served cold.
Fluffy Dog: Two customers from Fairfax England asked me to make their "favorite back home drink".
Pajama Jackhammer: Mix all ingredients and serve with shaved ice.
Dressed Up Like A Dogs Dinner: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Mountain Dew #1: Fill half beer glass with beer. Fill other half with 7-UP soda (If you have the patience, pour a little of one, then a little of the other, until the glass is full). Fill a shot glass with Melon liqueur. Drop entire shot glass into glass of beer. Immediately drink entire pint of beer with shot glass still inside (do not swallow the shot glass).
Carmel Candy Apple: The Carmel Apple is typically a "shot" drink. This variation makes a nice "sipper".
Fuzzy Screw: For those who like a Fuzzy Navel but with more of a kick.
Red Baron: Float schnapps on top of Rumple and enjoy!
Charlie Shaker: Wery tasty0coctail. Recommended before dinner. Made for a Bar contest in Norway 1991 by Ole Alex Wetten.
Blue Blazer: if done right it will look like liquid fire and will taste really good (Jack Daniels is perferred)
Casablanca #2: Shake not too short with enough ice.
Bushwacker #1: From N.W. Florida Bushwacker festival. Good drink!
Windex: Combine in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into cocktail glass.
Amaretto Stone Sour #2: Add Amaretto, OJ, and Sour in a tub over ice.
Radioactive Long Island Iced Tea: Served to me by Jenny at Cactus Jack's when I asked for something "a little different". Me and my big mouth.
BMW #2: Back in the day, two bartenders at Philthy McNasty's in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada were sitting around the bar trying different alcohols, trying to find the best tasting shot with a real smooth taste and a great aftertaste that you can still taste after a few more drinks. After trying about 15 shots each they started getting sloppy and careless. One of them grabbed the three bottles and mixed them up. He shot it back and the look of pure joy appeared on his face. The other one tried it and this was the beginning of the tastiest shot I've ever had. They came up with this shot and I wanted to share this great shot with all of you.
The King Of Denmark: The King of Denmark is actually the name of a traditional anise sweet which is very popular in Denmark.
Bearsicle: The colder the better. It makes a good first drink of the night.
Raspberry Long Island Ice Tea: This is a great alternative to the regular Long Island Ice Tea. The first time I tried the drink was in the Century Club in Los Angeles, Ca. I hope you find it as delightful as my friends and I do.
Splender Blenders: Enjoy on a hot summer afternoon!!!
Fiery Blue Mustang: Mix ingredients and light on fire. Blow out flame, saddle up, and enjoy the ride!
Electric Lemonade: This drink is a house specialty from the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.
Death in the afternoon: Pour the Pernod into the champagne flute and top off with the champagne.
Malibu Twister: Add rum & trister then, add cranberry jucie,stir
Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft: Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.
Nutz 'n Berries: This shot was taught to me by another bartender. I have been serving it constantly for two years now.
Nightboat to Recife: Shake with ice and pour into tumbler with crushed ice.
Fuzzy Logic: Beware. You can't taste the alcohol, so drink it and drop.
Fuck You: Mix each ingredient in a glass. Tilt glass 180 degrees and slam it!
Rocket Fuel #3: This shot really hurts. Me and some friends discovered it in a bar in Abbotsford, BC. We usually get it for someone on their birthday.
Zinger: Very good if you like surge and peaches. Try mixing a shot of Strawberry Schnapps too. Just add it to the other two.
Nutty Irishman (without milk): Pour the Frangelico first over a glass with ice. Then, pour the Bailey's over the top, but do not stir the drink.
Backdraft: Customer places hand over top of glass to form airtight seal that extinguishes flame. Straw is slid in between fingers keeping seal as tight as possible. Drink beverage through straw. Remove straw after drink is finished. Put glass to nose and remove hand to allow burnt fumes to be inhaled through nose. Definitely a one-a-nighter.
Kongepjolter: Pour the Cognac in the mug, then mix the Champagne in.
Slugger's Delight: This drink dates back to the old party days after baseball practice. The traditional Rum and Coke became too boring and weak, so ordinary rum gave way to 151 rum. Then one night there was no more Coke, so we settled for Rock & Rye. We never bought Coke again. As you'll see, the taste is far superior and the product packs a punch.
Butter Cream: Let it sit for just a minute to mix well.
Easy does it: Bailey's first. Pour Kahlua. Float Everlear. Bottoms up!
Cherried Cream Rum: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Liquid Heroine: Mix Rumple Minze and Jägermeister in an iced shaker and strain into shot glass
Cina Polada: After one of these special pina coladas, you'll be asking for another Cina Polada. One per person.
Gorilla Fart #5: Pour 1oz of Yukon Jack into shot glass. Pour 1oz of Bacardi 151 into shot glass.
Dirtiest Ernie: Mix the three ingredients in a shot glass and slam
Moose Fart: Best to make in a pitcher, and I'm not talking about Kerry Woods! Use large amounts, as this drink is sure to be a hit!
Shimmers: Served on the rocks. Pour the St. Hallvard first, then the aquavit. Add a lemon twist.
KoolShock: Place a few ice cubes into the glass, add the Aftershock, then the Kool-Aid. Stir to mix. Enjoy
Lone Tree Cocktail: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Olympia: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Park Avenue: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Lady Scarlett: Jaroslav Krátký, C.B.A., Czech-Republic 1. in International Bartenders Associantions Intenational Cocktail Competition, Tokyo 1996. -- Category: Pre Dinner
Thug Heaven: Fill cocktail glass with ice and mix the two ingredients.
Fairytale: I invented the drink this very night. Tastes fantastic.
Flaming Rasta: I learded this drink in the Virgin Islands. Everyone that has done it so far loves it..
Feliz Natal: Feliz Natal is Portuguese for Happy Christmas and the cocktail is inspired by the flavours of a rich liqueur chocolate cake eaten at this time of year. The heady flavours of Brandy and Port from the Douro region of Portugal, some dried cherries, wrapped in Marzipan and coated in chocolate. Let christmas last all year! Feliz Natal!
Golden Cadillac: Combine all ingredients with 1/2 cup crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at low speed for ten seconds. Strain into a champagne flute and serve.
Duck Fart: layered- bottom to top Kahlua, Bailey's, Canadian Club
Pouce Coupe Puddle: Good start on a warm glow during the summer nights! This drink originated from a group of crazies. A group that partakes in the eventfull fun of skinny dipping at Pouce Coupe River. Drink 5 and I promise you'll join us in skinny dipping:) Here's to Northern Lights and *Cheers*
Red Horn: RedRum can either be mixed with the cider, or floated on top. Serve cold.
Berry-Berry: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
Chocolate Shock: Add 1 shot of After Shock to 8 oz cup of hot chocolate and enjoy.
Clamato Cocktail: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Mikey Mike: Mix ingredients in a tumbler and shake thoroughly. Pour over ice into a 10 oz. glass and enjoy.
Vit Ryss: Mix everything in a highballglas and add some ice.

Christer Petterson: Mix and serv with crushed ice
Bali Dream: Put all ingredients in shaker together with some ice-cubes. Shake well. Serve with piece of banana on top of the glass.
Mean Green Love Making Machine: Put ingredients in shaker, shake, pour over ice.
Whistling Gypsy: Goes down smooth with a great aftertaste.
Baked Apple: Pour the liqueur into the glass first, then add the Cider. Serve cold.

Lager & Lime: A great drink on a warm summer day!
Robitussin: Stirred, best without the rocks. Tastes just like the real thing
Jeweler's Hammer: This drink is sooo good you will probably want to add 2 oz. of Vodka to 8 oz. of white grape juice. Add more or less Vodka to taste and pour over ice. Enjoy!
White Splash: This drink comes from The Netherlands and has a surprisingly taste.
Cul-De-Sac: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine both of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Wet Snatch: Add blue raspberry to ice, add vanilla, pinapple, and coconut, then blend. Add tequila, blend again. Whipped cream on top optional.
Four Twenty: I would also suggest that you use the cheap white wine- the boxed stuff. This makes it a bit more authentic and keeps it in the College Student style. If done correctly, one should not taste the vodka and it should be quite smooth. This drink was originated at Maine Martime Academy and is a favorite of the school's sailing team.

The Lady in Red: You will taste a hint of peppermint at first, and then the peach kicks in. It's really smooth.
The Seminole: This drink comes from the bars of Tennessee St. at Florida State University. The way to slam it is easy. Everyone has seen the tomahawk chop, so you slam the shot and then you have to do the tomahawk chop right afterward. Use beer as a chaser, or water if you are from the University of Florida. GO NOLES!!!
Grizzly Bear: Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.
Green Cookie Monster: For a smoother, sweeter taste, use rum as the top of the shooter. For a stronger shooter that burns your nose, use vodka.
Washington Apple Martini: Posted by Natrone in the forums on 20. Nov. 2004.
Tequila Gimlet: Shake well with ice in a shaker and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Bailey's Cup of Coffee: Preferably drinken in front of an open fire.
Smeraldo: Put all in a Shacker with Ice, shake it for a while and serve in a cold Cocktail glass
Absolut Symphony: Shake. Pour into glass and add Sprite. Garnish with a strawberry.
Kryptonite kooler: For an out of this world green drink, you have to try this.
Double Brit: Don't be afriad to let it linger in your mouth before you swallow, especially if you have used quality ingredients. It sounds like a brutally simple shot, but can really have an eloquent flavor if done properly. Also, as you might have guessed, this drink is *very* strong, so be careful!
Texas Apple Delight: This is a great drink to have at a party with friends. It will also keep you from getting a hangover the next day!
The Vaitkus: shake ingredients together and pour into a cocktail glass. drink quickly!
Surfer On Acid #2: Cannot substitute Chambord for anything. A phrase some of my fellow bartenders say "You can pour Chambord over a terd and it would taste good".
Seduction on the Rocks: This is a very sweet but very good drink!
Hurricane flint: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass and serve.
French Connection: Pour ingredients into a old-fashioned glass over ice, stir, and serve.
Hilde's Special: Try it, it will blow your socks off !!
R-Float: After stirring ingredients,Drink should look just like a rootbeer float and taste even better. Discovered by a bar owners daughter and another bartender.
Freddie's Naughty Neopolitan: Layer in a shot glass. First Kahlua, then white creme de cacao, and finally Baja Rosa Tequila.
Pink Lemonade: Mix Shake Can be made as an up cocktail or on the rocks
Liquid Crack: Pour one-third of Rumple Minze, Jägermeister, and Goldschlager into a shot glass
Captain's and Creme: Cream soda doesn't have much carbonation in the first place, so try not to stir too much.
Kamel Drivare: Pour the Sambuca into a shotglass, then layer the Bailey's over by pouring it over the back of a spoon.
Princeton Cocktail: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Real Romulan Ale: CAUTION: This drink is extremely alcoholic and quite flammable! Do NOT expose to open flame and drink responsibly! NOTE: If you're not one of the few that enjoys the sensation of white-hot liquid crawling down the back of your throat then you might want to consider "Romulan Ale Light". Simply follow the directions listed above and, when you're ready to imbibe, pour the shot in to a 12-ounce glass and fill with Sprite. Variations include strawberry soda, pineapple soda, orange sode, Cherry 7-Up, and grape soda. Remember, you haven't had REAL Romulan Ale until you've sucked down a shot!
Kumoniwannalaya: Fruity, with a bit of a kick. Tis is another creation from the Delta chi archives!!!!
Bob Marley: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass
Igloo Sue: Fill glass with ice or snow. Pour in lemonade. Add Vodka. Splash in grenadine (it should seep to the bottom).
Vixen: I didn't invent it, but everyone I've made it for wanted the receipe!
Irish Flag: Layer: creme de menthe, irish cream and brandy
Snake Bite (UK): Pour ingredients into a pint glass. Drink. Fall over.
Maiden's Prayer #2: Shake with crushed ice and strain into a chilled wine or cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Velvet Hammer #1: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Irish Monk #2: Pour ingredients into the shot glass in the following order: - Baileys first, - Frangelico next, - Brandy on top.
Caribbean Boilermaker: Pour the Corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the rum into the beer.
Simpson Solution: This will definately get about 15-20 light weights ripped, or 5 alcoholics. Name commemorates our beloved O.J. Simpson, and Orange Juice. Also known as the nectar of the gods.
Charlie Chaplin: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Absolut Stress #1: Pour all ingredients into a mixing tin and shake with ice. Pour into a collins glass. No garnish.
Texas Rose: Mix all ingredients and pour over ice. Wonderful smooth tasting drink. But watch out it will knock your socks off!
Cerebral Hemorage: This is an excellent tasting drink....it can be done with out the Grenadine, if you don't like the taste, but then it's just a "brain". Regardless, this is one of the better drinks around simply for taste....it'll get ya drunk, too, though! Get to it!!!!
Swimming Pool: Mix ingredients with some ice in a shaker. Strain into a glass over some ice.
Incredible Hulk: pour ingredients over ice in normal glass

Fifth Avenue: Pour ingredients into a parfait glass (in order given) so that each ingredient floats on preceding one. Serve without mixing.
Super Bloody Screwdriver: Be careful, this on will knock you on your ass. This will teach you a lesson. I had a hard-core drinker slam a few of these, he puked on my couch in his sleep!
Adios Mother: This drink started in Newport Beach, CA.
Minttini: Shake all ingredients with cubed ice, then pour into a martini glass. Garnish with a mint leaf.
Zimadori Zinger: Pour Zima in a collins glass over ice and then pour the shot of Midori. Don't stir. Garnish with a cherry.
Rum Snapp: Drink must be served cold. May add ice.
Midori Mimosa: Pour Midori and sweet&sour.; Add champagne.
Kryptonite: Will knock you on your ass! And can also be set on fire and sucked through a straw.
Big Stick: Build over ice in an 11 oz. glass Looks and tastes like a big stick popsicle
Virulent Death: Combine in shot glass and stir.
Vodka Stinger: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Frisco: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon slice.
Flaming Cornholio: A friend of mine stumbled upon this one night at a party in Clinton County, IL!!
Dakota: Combine in a double shot glass and enjoy.
Lamb Brothers: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Mudslide #1: Mix with cracked ice in a shaker. Serve in a chilled highball glass
Claridge Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Mexican Mouthwash: Pour into shaker chill, and gently swirl together.
Tennessee Tea: This recipe comes directly from Jack Daniel's Distillery in Tennessee, which offers wonderful tours if you're ever in that area. It makes a great punch.
The Bomb: an original drink by Dale Rockhill, Club Oxygen, Huntsville, Alabama
Beam Me Up Scottie Mac: Chill rum. Then layer. Creme de Banana first, then Bailey's and float rum on top.
B-54: Also great mixed in with hot coffe of hot chocolate
Mind over Marny: Summer drink. Garnish with anything other than onions or olives. Fruitopia's "Mind over Mango", while a tasty beverage, is not as good a mixer as it may seem. Stick with the real.
Wonder Woman: Sweet drink -- ladies love it. Party Punch Originated in Corvallis, Oregon at the Royal Pacific Lounge. Has swept the state and is a popular drink at virtually every bar. Enjoy!
Gorilla's Puke: Layer in normal shot glass. Can be lit and shot through straw.
Pink Fix: Nice drink to start off the evening before moving onto stronger libations.
Pick Me Up Jose: Lay shot glass in a CLEAN ash tray right side up, and start to pour the drinks into te glass till they overflow into the ash tray. then light the liquer on fire, blow it out, take the shot from the shot glass, then drink out of the ash tray. ENJOY
Bad Habit: Combine in a shot glass, vodka first.
Kamakazie #1: shake well with ice, pour strained mixture into shooter. Salute'
Deep, Dark Secret: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Poison Apple: Pour ingredients over ice in shaker. Shake and strain into shot glass.
Butterbee: Also known as "Cock Sucker" and "Slippery Nipple".
Cranberry Apple Martini: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass
Zorro: add all and pour black coffee and add whipped cream on top.
Hairball: All the different flavors blend very well, and it will give you a swift kick in the butt!

Foreplay: Mix both ingredients together in a tumbler with ice. Strain into a shot glass! Enjoy!
Alley Shooter: Pour all ingredients over ice and mix together. Strain into a glass and shoot it.
Hair Raiser: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Lombomba: pour the ingredients into a norma drink glass with a few ice-cubes. stirr.
Toolkit: Mix all ingredients and pour into shot glasses. Slam it!!
Honolulu Cocktail No. 2: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Malibu Seven: Mix the 7-up and rum together in a cup of ice.
Grateful Dead: shake ingredients and pour over ice...

Limona Corona: Forget adding lemon or lime to your Coronas. This drink is much better.

Aperol '86: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with strawberry.
Lazy Haze: It may sound nasty but is very good. Came about by accident on a very busy night. Glad I had to drink my mistakes! :o)

Wookie: Down the drink a follow with a hearty Chewbacca roar.
Kris Kringle: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota

Goombay Smash #2: fill tall glass with ice, add all ingredients and shake well.
Peach Daiquiri: Blend Ice until throughly crushed. Add Rum, Peach Nectar, and Schapps. Lightly blend until mixed well. Add Frozen Peaches. Blend until slushy. Enjoy

Beth's Own: Mix alcohol first, then add cola.
Evil Slider: Made best with Turkey Hill Iced Tea
Tangaz\u00e9: Delisous also with a oz of coke.
Mexican Rose: Shake & strain into glass or blend.
The Milky Way: A nice and smooth shot with a little cinnomon twist.
Donnington Brainstorm: Mix well the Thunderbird with the Vodka and pour into an empty litre coke/lemonade bottle. The exact ratio of vodka:thunderbird can be altered to the creator's taste. Fridge for at least 12 hours. Donnington Brainstorm is best at temperatures between 2-4 degrees centigrade. If the drink is too cold it will tend to be too bitter; if it is too warm, it will tend to be too sweet. At just the right temperature, it should be light, refreshing, slightly peary and the alcohol taste minimal. Drink (with friends) VERY CAREFULLY.....
David Bareface: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Butterballs: Use a double shot glass. Pour the Butterscotch Schnapps first, then the coffee liqueur.
Cioccolato e cocco: Mix all ingredients thoroughly and pour in glass.
Bitchin' Apple Cider: Try it warm during the winter months.
Electric Screwdriver: dump the shots in glass then fill with oj to taste
Backseat Boogie #2: This drink was made when Dan, Freddy and JP went to an open bar and there was five minutes left before it closed, they each order a vodka-cran and gin-ginger, to make it go down fast to have more, they mixed the tow together and were pleased with the mix. Hope you enjoy too.
Poire Fantastic: Take a Highball glass, pour in the Poire au Cognac. Add Sprite. Put in some ice if you want.

Pr\u00e6rieb\u00e5l (Norwegian version o: Avoid this drink if you've got a weak heart or gastric ulcer.
Army special: It is said that it comes from the ranks of the Indian Army. It tastes slghtly sour and makes a very nice afternoon cocktail
Grapefruit and Orange Cocktail: Mix and stir with ice in a mixing glass, strain off into a large cocktail glass.

Plead the 5th: mix all on the rocks,shake,strain,and serve.
Clove Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
Sizzler: Mix all to gether until fizzing.
Screaming Orgasm (San Francisco Style): BTW, its the Cognac that makes it 'screaming' for a standard Orgasm, no Cognac.

Cherry Martinsen: Pour in the brandy and then the coke, biatch. Hold up the glass and say dude. Enjoy dude.

Brown Cocktail: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Gorilla Fart #4: This shot is for those gung-ho fuckers that think they can drink anything, a few of these, heavin' is believin'. Have fun. Don't get scared. (In San Antonio lingo: don't puke.)

Dirty Bong Water: Pour all ingredients in a glass with ice. Mix and enjoy

Madeleine: This Cocktails is freely invented by me (Christoph Daugaard) This Cocktail is dedicated to a lovelely girl.
BearCat Special: Put both in shot glass, mix, and down.
Summertime: Just mix the ingredients. It can also be served without alchohol. Just mix equal amounts of sprite light and orange juice.

'57 Chevy with a White License Plate: 1. Fill a rocks glass with ice 2.add white creme de cacao and vodka 3.stir

Jim Morrison: "Oh show me, the way, to the next whiskey bar, oh don't ask why, oh don't ask why, for if we don't find, the next whiskey bar, I tell you we must die, I tell you we must die, I tell you, I tell you, I tell you we must die!" -- This one's harsh ladies, and gentleman. Any whiskey lover will love it.

The Triple: Guarenteed to surge the alcohol into your blood. Cool combo of flavors. Use Citron, Kurrant, or Peppar for a different kind of kick.

Wahoo: Over ice add 151 and amaretto. Top off with pineapple juice.
A Little Dinghy: Created by bar staff at Houlighan's, Troy, MI.
Dick Deming Martini: Invented by Mr. Deming from Maine.
Green Meanie: A great hit. Taste like apple Jolly Ranchers
Raging Indian: Mix a lot and mix in shaker. Pour shot.
Limonaide: This drink is really good you don't even really taste the rum so its just lemonade with a hidden kick.
Poison Milk: Don't drink too many! The Jägermeister is potent. I got horribly sick after shooting 9 of them one Fourth of July.

Landed Gentry: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Southern Joe: Pour both ingredients into shot glass. Consume Repeatedly
Lifesaver: Shake well. Serve in rocks glass

It was a local favorite and the bar still uses it.
Raspberry Cream: Blend all ingredients in an electric blender at a low speed. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.
Mudslinger: Appearance will be similar to that of muddy water, but it tastes great!!

PB&J; #2: Drink your Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich and get your date drunk at the same time.
Smarty: Mix all ing. over ice, strain and serve! Tastes like a sweet tart!
Fuzzy Russian: Mix both ingredients in a shot glass. Tilt head back. Swallow.
Russian Brunch: mix vodka and o.j. in blender with ice. add champaine and stir in.
Super Qell: Just fill a big glass with all the ingridients
Bermuda Rose: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
White Way Cocktail: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Romona Banana: Shake all ingredients and serve in shot glass.

Sammy Slammer: It is really sweet.. an actual good-tasting shot

Devastating Body Rocker: Created by Dave & Baldy at Papa Joe's.

Sex in the Desert: Nice. To be enjoyed in Baja, California. Cheers.
Kamakazie Razzberry: Pour Welch's concentrate into a pitcher, then add vodka and finally Raspberry Schnapps. Add crushed ice and stir.
Millennium Knockout: This drink has a very potent taste of aniseed from the galliano but mixes well with the orange juice. It is very strong and I would not recommend drinking more than two. It is a self invented drink that I tried out on the family for the Millennium. It will knock your socks off!
Capri: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
Slap Your Mama: Shake one part o.j. and one part vodka together. Pour over ice and add one part Mountain Dew, then stir slightly.
Soviet Sunset: Like a Kamikazee with club soda and a lemon flavor.
Captain's Treasure: Knock it back and give a pirate's "Arrr!"
Cyber Smoke: Blend all ingredients and pour into champagne flute. Add a small piece of edible dry ice.
Kahlua Sour: Mix Kahlua and lemon juice, add sugar and enjoy.
Black Maria: Combine and stir all ingredients in a brandy snifter. Add cracked ice and serve.
North Polar: Mix and server over ice with a slice of orange
Fuzzy Irishman: Pour Raspberry first, Butterscotch next and Irish cream last. Need not be layered but pour in order given. Top 'O the Mornin' to you!
Bumble Bee #1: This is a layered shot. First pour the Bailey's into the shot glass. Then take an upside down spoon and touch it to the inside wall of the glass. Carefully add the Kahlua. Repeat this process for the Sambuca. If done properly, the alcohol will stay separated and resemble a bumble bee. Enjoy!!!
Fire And Ice: Layer the Rumple Minze on top of the Firewater (as best as possible)
Boilermaker: Fill shot glass with whiskey. Drop full shot glass into mug o' beer. Drink immediately, enjoy.
Chocolate Honeybee: Pour Barenjaeger in a shot glass and top with Godiva.
Yellow Parrot: Stir with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Banana Strawberry Shake Daiquiri-type: Blend all together in a blender until smooth.
8 iron: Pour equal parts of each in the the shot glass
Shogun: Mix in blender and garnish with orange slice
Mountain Sex: Pour Mountain Dew in glass then add Triple Sec and stir.
Louie Louie: Created when a friend of mine poured some of his black russian into my glass of southern comfort. To our surprise, it was good.
Black Martini #1: Poor ingredients over ice. Shake gently. Strain into cocktail glass.
Comfortable Screw: Pour Southern Comfort and O.J together and serve chilled
Scooby Snack #3: Pour all into shaker with ice. Shake until cold. Strain into highball glass.
Mocha Martini: mix ingredients in a shaker with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass
Malibu Screw: Add chilled orange juice to the vodka and Malibu. Ice is optional.
Belles Of St. Mary's: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Kiltlifter: Shake gently and pour over ice in old fashioned glass.
Block and Fall: This drink is included in the international Bartenders Association's 50 World Cocktails.
Watermelon Shooter #4: Mix ingredients in a cocktail shaker full of ice. Strain into glass.
Dirty Mother: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes, stir well, and serve.
